$pacifist_before = $pacifist>><<set $friendly_before = $friendly>><<set $involved_before = $involved>>You travel for several hours on horseback by your sister's and Commanders' side, heading for the Royal Castle you fled one month ago. The procession is mostly silent; after all, your goal is to inconspicuously and stealthily proceed under the cover of the dark night. When you're a mile away from the castle, you slip out of the plains to sneak inside the forest circling the fortified building's side and back. Dense trees will give you enough cover to lurk closer without the soldiers on the ramparts—whose presence you can surmise from the bright torches at their sides—spotting you from a distance. Cyril's unit lingers back, getting into position to prepare the impending attack on the castle's gates, the diversion needed for Ariana to create an opening in the wall. You temporarily abandon your mounts at the outskirts of the woods; they would not be able to proceed smoothly in the shrubbery. "Thirty minutes," Ariana says, a reminder that Cyril will be proceeding with the first phase of the plan after that amount of time has passed. You follow her between the trees, into the dark forest. <center><<button [[Next|Ch12_02]]>><</button>></center>Ahead of you, navigating easily through the woods, are the soldiers of Ariana's small squad, twenty men and women handpicked by Cyril; behind you trails $wilfred at the helm of $w_his own company, half of your total force, several hundred soldiers, while the other half remained with Cyril. The trees stand a little apart from each other, clustered only in some specific spots. Walking in their midst is not the ordeal you might have expected. The only impediment to your movements might be the near absence of light, but you find yourself quickly adjusting to the dimness. Except for the sound of footsteps and your own breathing, the forest is deadly silent. You're almost at the back of the castle when cries of alert erupt, a distant echo almost lost to the night. Your group quickens its pace, and as you reach the edge of the forest, you glimpse the walls of your family's castle, gray and high against the black sky, the very same walls that have watched you grow up. You've been gone a month from your home, and now has come the time to reclaim it. As you've finally reached the outskirts of the woods, the predetermined point where you are to start your assault on the castle, it is clear, from the sounds of violence rising ahead, that Cyril's forces have launched their attack on the gates. Ariana looks back at you, her eyes locking with yours for the briefest moment before she turns to survey the soldiers at her back. She gives them a signal, a swift move of her hand in a beckoning motion, and the small unit moves as one, walking in her steps as she bolts, stance low, out of the forest and onto the clear plain. <ul> <li>[[I follow her, in accordance with the plan.->Ch12_03][$late = false]]</li> <li>[[I stay back, in spite of the plan.|Ch12_02a][$late = true, $aff_will to $aff_will.fm(-5), $leader -= 1, $army_support -= 1]]</li> </ul><<if $late == false>>You move with her, under the barely-there moonlight that, although dim, makes you feel utterly exposed over the grassy plains. <</if>>You run, fast and close to the ground, darting across the empty expanse towards the castle walls. As you look up, towards the ramparts, you can see lights and hear the noises of battle coming from the other side of the castle, but thankfully, none seems the wiser to your current approach. The wall is within reach, only a few feet away. <center><<button [[TWACK!|Ch12_04]]>><</button>></center>You stand by a tree, and simply watch as Ariana moves to close the distance to the castle walls. There are archers, atop the ramparts, but they seem otherwise occupied at the moment, facing the other way in the direction of the assaulted gates. You turn as hurried steps close in on you. It's $wilfred, approaching you with a weary look. "Why aren't you following Ariana?" <ul> <li>[[I don't deign to give an answer.|Ch12_02b][$response = 0, $diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(-10), $aff_will to $aff_will.fm(-5)]]</li> <li>[['"Why should I?"'->Ch12_02b][$response = '"Why should I?"', $aff_will to $aff_will.fm(-5), $diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(-10), $timid to $timid.fm(-5)]]</li> <li>[['"Better vantage point from here."'->Ch12_02b][$response = '"Better vantage point from here."', $aff_will to $aff_will.fm(-5), $playful to $playful.fm(5), $timid to $timid.fm(-5)]]</li> <li>[['"I was going to."'|Ch12_02d][$response = 0]]</li> <li>[[I don't answer; I am petrified with fear.|Ch12_02b][$response = 0, $timid to $timid.fm(5)]]</li> </ul><<nobr>> <<if $response != 0>> $response <br><br> <</if>> <<set $response = 0>> <</nobr>>$w_He lurks closer to whisper in too loud a tone, "This isn't the plan. You are to remain with Ariana." <<print $w_he.toUpperFirst()>> steps back, an authoritative arm raised in Ariana's direction. "Go." <ul> <li>[["I ignore " + $w_him + "."->Ch12_02c][$response = 0]]</li> <li>[["″Bold of you to assume you can order me around, " + $mcwill + ".″"->Ch12_02c][$response = 1, $timid to $timid.fm(-10)]]</li> <li>[[I follow Ariana.|Ch12_02d][$response = 1]]</li> </ul><<if $response == 1>><<set $response = 0>>You slide a defiant gaze $w_his way. "Bold of you to assume you can order me around, $mcwill." A twitch in $w_his cheek, and $w_he regards you an instant with a scrutinizing piercing gaze, a shift in $w_his expression and in $w_his stance.<<else>>You pay $w_him no heed. $w_He looks hard at you, twists to glance at Ariana who's almost at the wall, then back at you with an angry glint in $w_his eye, clear to see even in the dark.<</if>> <<set $aff_will to $aff_will.fm(-10), $army_support -= 1>>"I will <i>not</i> say it again," $w_he declares, in a clear voice this time. "Go. <i>Now</i>." You hear the clink of $w_his sword before you see $w_his hand reaching for it. "Deserters and mutineers will <i>not</i> be tolerated. Whomever they might be." $wilfred has hundreds of soldiers at $w_his back. You don't. Reluctantly, you step away from your hideout place, and sprint out after your sister. <center><<button [[Next|Ch12_03]]>><</button>></center>You come to a stumbling halt as an arrow stabs the ground in front of you. You look up. The archer that has almost impaled you looks right back at you. They shout something, and more archers appear high above. "We've been spotted!" Ariana cries aptly, not stopping her dash towards the walls. You maneuver around the arrow, sprinting after your sister, and when you come within arm's reach, she quickly reaches for you, pulling you close. The contact sends a painful jolt of energy through you, making your teeth grind against each other and your fists tighten reflexively, but before you can bat her away, she pushes you with these words, "Cover me! I need you to keep the archers off my back while I focus!" You look back towards Ariana's squad. Twenty soldiers, now at your disposal, all of them equipped with a bow as well as a sword. <ul> <<if $politics < 50>><li>[[I order the soldiers to aim for the archers.->Ch12_04c]]</li><</if>> <<if $politics >= 50>><li>[[I order the soldiers to aim for the archers, making sure they are synchronized for maximum efficiency.->Ch12_04a]]</li><</if>> <li>[[I'm not doing a thing. She can die, for all I care.|Ch12_04b]]</li> <li>[[I don't know what to do! I'm too scared to act!|Ch12_04d]]</li> </ul><<set $leader += 1, $army_support += 1>>"Notch!" you order quickly; time is of the essence as you're currently out of cover, at the mercy of the archers high above who also have the advantage of the higher ground. "Draw!" you say next, and your soldiers point their bows up, ready to let go of their arrows when you next command it. "Loose!" you cry out, and twenty arrows whiz out in the damp night air; you hear a yelp above, and, behind you, feel a high-pitched buzz crawl right at the base of your skull. You pivot around. Ariana is glowing, a beacon of the destruction she is aiming to unleash on the castle wall. She gives you no time to prepare before she dashes forward, connecting with the wall in a blinding ball of energy. The ground shakes under your feet, and you sway, fighting to keep your balance. Light explodes in front of you. Almost an earthquake, stone fragments flying out all around and above you. You huddle down on instinct, protecting your head from any debris that might strike it. <center><<button [[Next|Ch12_05]]>><</button>></center><<set $leader -= 2, $army_support -= 2, $diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(-10)>>The soldiers stare at you, some blinking questioningly as you fail to give a single command. They don't remain static for long, however; the archers above resume sending arrows your way, so your soldiers aim up, loosing arrows back towards the ramparts. A high-pitched buzz suddenly crawls up the base of your skull, and you wince. You pivot around. Ariana is glowing, a beacon of the destruction she is aiming to unleash on the castle wall. She gives you no time to prepare before she dashes forward, connecting with the wall in a blinding ball of energy. The ground shakes under your feet, and you sway, fighting to keep your balance. Light explodes in front of you. Almost an earthquake, stone fragments flying out all around and above you. You huddle down on instinct, protecting your head from any debris that might strike it. <center><<button [[Next|Ch12_05]]>><</button>></center><<if ndef $textGroup>><<set $textGroup = 1>><</if>><<switch $textGroup>> <<case 1>>When you next raise your head, amidst the dust and the dry coughs you fight back, you are able to gauge the damage done to the castle structure; much greater than you had anticipated. A twenty feet wide section has been destroyed, bottom blown apart and top crumbled on top of it. The grass is littered with rocks of all sizes, and the bulk of the wall has collapsed inwards, bestrewn in huge chunks inside the castle proper. Beyond Ariana, in between the rubble, you spot multiple faces staring your way, lit torches peppered across the castle grounds, their fiery reflection dancing on the metal breastplates of Stanislas's soldiers. Amidst the sudden quiet, Ariana marches on, gait resolute and hand steady as she draws her longsword. She effortlessly scales the rocky debris, and you follow her, your soldiers trading their bows for their swords, and $wilfred's unit moving out of the forest behind you. <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<default>>You emerge in the middle of the gardens. They are almost as you remember, sprawling with flowers and verdant grass, only now crushed under boulders and heavy granite from the shattered wall. Hundreds of pairs of eyes watch your sister as she comes to stand atop the stones and rocks, all that remain from the castle wall. She's a tall silhouette highlighted by wavering flames, and the gazes on her are either awed or alarmed, the difference minute as she starts speaking, voice ringing in the sudden lull. "I am Ariana d'Arcadie," she declares, "the Kingdom's rightful Queen." Dust has not finished settling, and it shimmers in the night, twinkling stars around your sister. "Lay down your weapons, or die by the traitor's side. I will show no mercy to any who stand by Stanislas." You turn to the left as a loud bang rings out, a battering ram attacking the gates. Cyril's forces, on the other side of the still closed gates, are still trying to break them down. <<unset $textGroup>><center><<button [[CRACK!|Ch12_06]]>><</button>></center> <</switch>><<if def $textGroup>><<set $textGroup += 1>><</if>>Sharp metal against a solid blade, and your head swivels back towards Ariana as she deflects an arrow that's just been shot at her. "Soldiers!" a male voice booms, and you recognize Stanislas in the midst of his troops, longbow still raised in your sister's direction. He is still sporting the uniform of a commander of Arcadie, midnight blue and blood red trim. He has the same black eyes you remember, dark hair casting a bluish reflection as he passes near a torch, a new arrow notched at his long wooden bow. "The Queen will show no mercy to any of us. Nor shall we have any for her." You notice deep red fabric around both his forearms, running down and rolled around his palms; bandages or simply meant for decoration, you cannot tell. "Ariana," he calls. "The soldiers of Arcadie no longer have need for kings and queens, least of all one such as you." He aims his bow back at her. "Brothers and sisters!" he shouts. "It's time we rid the realm of the self-serving line of d'Arcadie tyrants!" A loud cry, his soldiers utterly undeterred by Ariana standing over them. She remains rooted in place, unmoving, unspeaking before the hundreds who stand defiantly against her rule, but as Stanislas sends flying a new arrow she barely manages to evade, she backs away, letting $wilfred's unit into the castle proper. <center><<button [[Next|Ch12_06bis]]>><</button>></center><<if $response == 1>>"Ariana! Watch out!" you cry. <<elseif $response == 2>>Hand on the hilt of your sword, you dash forward. He's much too close, however; you quickly realize that it is unlikely that you'll reach him before he reaches her. <</if>>The knight is within striking distance now, and just as he is about to bring his sword down on her, Ariana lays her eyes on him. A quick flick of her arm, and the longsword is knocked out of his hands in a long rising arc while he loses his balance completely, as if swept off by a furious gale. Ariana steps away, watching him heavily crash to the ground, and before he can attempt to get back to his feet, she plunges the tip of her sword into the gap between his helmet and armor. While more enemy soldiers approach to try their hand at taking her down, a group of your own men has answered her earlier call, flanking the both of you on all sides to prevent any further treacherous attacks against their Queen and $Prince. "Onward!" Ariana orders, undeterred, and you march on through the gardens, in the midst of the raging battle. <center><<button [[Next|Ch012_08bis]]>><</button>></center>You think you've reached the castle courtyard proper; there is solid pavement under your leather boots and no more friable soil or destroyed flowers. "There you are!" Ariana shouts, half-exhilarated, half-furious, and from her tone, you infer that she has spotted Stanislas at last. Indeed, as you peek ahead, you glimpse Stanislas several feet ahead, having traded his bow for a regular longsword. Several soldiers are standing between you and him, however. Up the ramparts, a sudden yell, and a woman meets her demise on the hard ground; an archer thrown down by $wilfred's unit, from what you can tell. You spot the $w_man $w_himself atop those very same ramparts, facing off against another soldier in close quarters while $w_his squad works to rid the area of the occupying force. To the left, Cyril's unit is facing a bit more opposition; there are barricades that have been erected inside the castle, and they are successful at slowing down their advance, at least for now. Still, you're with Ariana, and your mission is to take out Stanislas. <center><<button [[Next|Ch12_09bis]]>><</button>></center><<if $response == 1>>You slice your blade across her neck, sparing a second to watch her meet with the ground, blood droplets filling the air. You turn as Ariana screams, so loud it startles you,<<elseif $response == 2>>You slice through her arm, and she shouts, her sword clattering to the ground as she drops to her knees, cradling her injured limb. You leave her there, turning as Ariana screams, so loud it startles you,<<else>>The pommel of your sword connects, hard, with her right hand, and the momentum of her own failed attack makes her fall to the ground. You leave her there, turning as Ariana screams, so loud it startles you,<</if>> "Stanislas! Don't you <i>dare</i> run away!" Your eyes flick to the object of her ire; Stanislas is indeed backing away, running off out of your field of vision. Ariana instantly gives chase. Your surprised soldiers struggle to keep pace, as they're in full metal armor while she's barely slowed down by her leather protections. You run after her, fast, faster than your soldiers, narrowly dodging a sword aimed at your neck, and hearing the men behind you tackling your would-be murderer. Ariana is striking down any who stand in her way, swift and quick, all swirls of her lutecium sword and impatient displays of Aether as she shoots off her opponents' weapons right out of their grasp, sweeping them literally off their feet to stab them dead in a whirlwind of blood. Deep red drips down the length of her blade, and she follows Stanislas as he dives inside the northern castle wing, the one you visited last, one month ago; the one which holds the meeting room where your parents were murdered; the one which witnessed the start of it all. Something crumbles loudly behind you, and as you look back, you see the barricades being finally torn apart by Cyril's men, and you spot Cyril $c_himself commanding $c_his soldiers forward. Ariana has entered the castle, and so you follow. <center><<button [[Next|Ch12_10bis]]>><</button>></center><<if ndef $textGroup>><<set $textGroup = 1>><</if>><<switch $textGroup>> <<case 1>><<set $intervene = true>>The doors to the throne room are as wide as they are tall. Inside, the high roofs are held up by long stone beams on either side of a red carpet. Were it daytime, the throne room would be flooded with multicolored light cast by the stained-glass windows throughout the hall, on the walls and behind the two thrones at its end. Now, however, torches are the only source of light, casting a long shadow under Stanislas as he kneels to retrieve a round object right in the middle of the room. Several feet away, Ariana watches him, breath still quickened by her recent running, and as he holds up what you recognize as a shield with his left arm, she explodes in outrage, "That's my family's shield!" And the doors loudly slam shut behind you. <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<default>>Ariana looks back, sparing only a glance of her narrowed eyes at the doors before facing Stanislas again. "Not only are you a murderer, a coward and a liar, but you're a thief as well." She paces around him, slowly, inching closer by careful degrees. "I shouldn't be surprised. No matter. You'll soon atone for all of your sins with your life, <i>Stanislas</i>." His name between her teeth sounds like an insult, but he spares no reaction for any of her words, positioning himself in a battle-ready stance. "How are your hands not burning up?" Ariana asks suddenly, ire momentarily leaving her voice to be replaced by curious indignation. "This shield is made of lutecium. No one but the Arcadie line can hold it." The shadow of a smile appears between his lips. "There are many things you don't know, <i>Your Majesty</i>," he replies with a sort of fake, affable friendliness, probably meant to aggravate Ariana further and succeeding remarkably well at it. "There is one thing I know for certain," she snaps back, sword at the ready, body taut like a spring ready to burst forward. "I <i>will</i> make you pay. I will make you beg for a quick death, and I will not be giving it to you. Not until I've made you rue the day you chose to turn on us." She gives no heed to the fact that you are presently both trapped in a room with Stanislas, as a result of a clear plan of his own. "Indeed, you are your parents' daughter," he says, a smile in his voice. "Boastful. Pugnacious. Excellent at threatening and exacting violence, and not much else." Ariana is about to attack. If you wish to intervene in any way, it is now or never. <<unset $textGroup>><ul> <li>[[″There is no need for any of this!″ Stanislas could still surrender.->Ch12_11a][$forgive_stan += 1]]</li> <<if $aff_stan >= 60 || $pacifist >= 60>><li>[["″" + $stanname + "! There is no need for further bloodshed!″ Stanislas might still listen to reason."->Ch12_11b][$forgive_stan += 1, $aff_stan to $aff_stan.fm(15)]]</li><<else>><span style="color:grey; pointer-events: none"><li>″$stanname! There is no need for further bloodshed!″ Stanislas might still listen to reason.</li></span><</if>> <li>[[I hold my sword tight. I will strike if I see an opportunity to do so.->Ch12_12]]</li> <li>[[I don't wish to intervene.->Ch12_12][$intervene = false]]</li> </ul> <</switch>><<if def $textGroup>><<set $textGroup += 1>><</if>><<set $pacifist to $pacifist.fm(5), $diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(5)>>"There is no need for any of this!" you declare, stepping forward, and they both look at you. "What?!" snaps Ariana. <ul> <li>[[I appeal to Ariana's senses.->Ch12_11Ariana]]</li> <li>[[I appeal to Stanislas's senses.->Ch12_AStan]]</li> </ul>"Stanislas!" you call, and he flicks a cautious gaze at you. "There is no need for further bloodshed! Aren't you a proponent of peace?" He watches you intently, dark eyes gauging you in silence. "I am," he says eventually, readjusting his shield—your family's shield, eyes now locked on Ariana. "But for Arcadie and her people to know peace, your family has to be removed from the throne. Once and for all." "Why so adamant that my family must pay the ultimate price for Arcadie to be at peace?" you ask. "You never even tried to parley with us; you simply decided to murder my family at a peace meeting." Stanislas looks at you once more, saying nothing while you continue, "What sort of peace are you planning to usher, on the back of murder and deceit?" There is a strange air of amused melancholy crossing his features. "It is a pity. Had the rest of your family been more like you, we might have been able to reach a compromise, once. Now, however, it is far too late." Your sister scoffs. "Indeed, it is." <center><<button [[Next|Ch12_12]]>><</button>></center>Ariana rushes forward with a scream, and her blade meets with the round shield in Stanislas's grasp. A loud metallic clang rings out, splitting your ears. What little Aether she has left, Ariana must be using now, as her moves are too quick to be natural. Stanislas holds his ground remarkably well, however; he shows himself to be a skilled fighter, as he either blocks or evades all of her attacks, no matter how swift they are. Dawn light starts pouring through the windows, and it casts a blue and purple glow on every one of your sister and Stanislas's moves, their blades drawing a dance that could be elegant if it weren't meant to end in death. <ul> <li>[[I check the doors.->Ch12_Doors]]</li> <li>[[I remain where I am.->Ch12_Remain]]</li> </ul><<if ndef $textGroup>><<set $textGroup = 1>><</if>><<switch $textGroup>> <<case 1>>Your sword is a heavy weight in your hand as you approach the two combatants. You watch, a little to the side, as their blades meet in a rattle of metal. Once, twice— The third time, neither of them relent, weapons grinding against another until Stanislas throws a solid kick into Ariana's midsection. She fumbles back, and before he can try to seize the opportunity to strike her, you step in his way. His dark eyes snap to you, quizzical only for an instant before he directs the full force of his deadly focus on you. He throws a quick thrust your way, aiming at your shoulder. You sidestep mostly on instinct, striking back, but he easily blocks you with his shield, just as Ariana aims her sword at his neck. He's not quick enough to completely avoid it. You see a spurt of blood, his eyes squeezed shut as he hisses in pain, spinning away to put distance between you. There is a cut on the left side of his face, blood dripping down from the red line stretching from his jaw all the way back to his ear. Ariana lets out a short laugh next to you, and Stanislas looks between you, breath shorter and gaze harder. <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<default>>Bright dawn light washes into the long room. The multicolored panels cast bejeweled changing colors over the stone floor, the red carpet, glinting off Stanislas's sword and shield. He goes into a lower stance, shield raised and blade pointing downwards. He waits for either of you to strike first. <<unset $textGroup>><ul> <li>[[I go first.->Ch12_13_MCGoesFirst][$timid to $timid.fm(-5)]]</li> <li>[[I let Ariana go first.->Ch12_13_AriGoesFirst]]</li> </ul> <</switch>><<if def $textGroup>><<set $textGroup += 1>><</if>>You squeeze your eyes shut at the sudden explosion of light. You step back, terrible noise and the buzz you've come to associate with Aether crawling painfully along your spine, and the room fills with scorching heat. When you blink your eyes open, you can only stare at the gaping hole in the wall several feet ahead of Stanislas. Your sister is nowhere to be seen. Stanislas spares you no mind, stepping forward, towards the opening in the wall. He steps over the rubble and disappears from view. You follow him. <center><<button [[Next|Ch12_15]]>><</button>></center><<if ndef $textGroup>><<set $textGroup = 1>><</if>><<switch $textGroup>> <<case 1>>Their swords meet once, twice, thrice. She lets out a short laugh, and attacks again. Stanislas manages to block her; but his moves, too, seem sluggish; he's getting tired, and almost leaves himself open for another successful blow, twisting away, just barely, right before his right arm would have met with Ariana's sword. Bright dawn light washes into the long room. The multicolored panels cast bejeweled changing colors over the fighters as they both stop a second to catch their breath, watching each other, looking for weak points and opportunities to put an end to the duel. <<unset $textGroup>><center><<button [[Next|Ch12_13_AriGoesFirst]]>><</button>></center> <</switch>><<if def $textGroup>><<set $textGroup += 1>><</if>><<if ndef $textGroup>><<set $textGroup = 1>><</if>><<switch $textGroup>> <<case 1>>The smell of blood is everywhere; you're not sure why you hadn't noticed it before, not sure if you're only noticing it now because there is a clear wound on Stanislas's face. But as your eyes trail down, you notice droplets of blood all over; on the stone beams, on the stone floors. You're not sure of their origin, and don't have time to wonder. "I don't know how you're able to use our shield," Ariana says, "and I don't care. I'll let Nathaniel have a field day with your corpse. He'll have answers." Blood is drawing thin lines along the left side of Stanislas's face, dripping down onto his dark blue jacket, and you notice the slightest shiver of exhaustion in his sword arm. "I'm done with this." With a loud cry, Ariana lights her sword on fire again. The glow of her sword is dimmer than before; she must not have much Aether left at her disposal. Stanislas braces himself all the same, shield at the ready. It washes over you, and as its heat licks your skin, you start to lose feeling in your every limb. For a moment, your very sense of self subsides; no sensation in your hands, arms, legs; no scent, no sight; just a rippling wind of buzzing energy over your entire being. <<set $aether_charge = 100>>Then it's gone, and your consciousness leaves with it. <center><<button [[You fall...|Ch13_Start]]>><</button>></center>Nothingness. Cyril casts a surprised look at you, but doesn't move. <</if>>You grab $c_his sword, and prepare yourself to face off against the enemy as soldiers emerge from the thicket. "There you are," the one in the middle says, voice vibrating with triumph, not breaking his stride as he draws his weapon. His accomplices do the same, and you find yourself facing three opponents. "That's <<print $c_sir.toUpperFirst()>> Cyril, over there," the man says. "Take $c_him out, before $c_he tries anything funny." <ul> <li>[["I place myself between Cyril and them. That'll give me more of a fighting chance.->Ch13_FightC_B]]</li> </ul>You sprint away, jump over a root and hide behind a tree. Concealed behind a trunk, you freeze and hold your breath, unwilling to give away your position as a voice rises a few feet behind you. "You're <<print $c_sir.toUpperFirst()>> Cyril, aren't you?" asks a male voice. "Where's the $prince?" "<<print $he.toUpperFirst()>> ran ahead a while ago," Cyril lies. "I stayed here. I would only slow $him down, you understand." "I understand quite well. Let's put you out of your misery, then." Swords sliding out of their scabbards, metal whizzing through the air. You feel a cold sweat at your back. "That would be quite a waste, wouldn't it?" Cyril says, strangely calm. You can hear the smile in $c_his voice as $c_he continues, "You seem to know who I am. I would be much more valuable to you alive than dead. Stanislas will need money and men for his military campaign. I have plenty of both." There's only silence for a while. Your heart beats fast, and you only swallow once you hear swords returning inside their scabbards. "True. Doubtful you'll survive the trip back to the castle, however, with your injury." A loud roar, and a fumble to draw their weapons back out; you're not sure what's happening, but a fight seems to rage on behind you, swords clashing and bodies tumbling to the ground. You flatten yourself further against the tree, its bark scratching the palm of your hands as cries and screams echo through the forest. A deep quiet follows not long afterwards, and you hear Cyril letting out a sigh of relief. "$wilfred, you're a sight for sore eyes." "Where's $mcname?" "<<print $he.toUpperFirst()>> ran off." You hear $c_him grunt in pain, perhaps standing up. "Either $he's hiding somewhere, or $he's in the process of getting lost in the woods." "As if this day could get any worse… $mcname!" $wilfred calls, loud enough to shake you. You come out of your hiding spot, gingerly approaching as $wilfred helps steady Cyril, who's clearly having a hard time staying upright. Four soldiers are with $w_him. "You're unharmed," $w_he ascertains with a quick glance. "We have to leave, now. Stan's men are right behind us." <center><<button [[Next|Ch13_Fort_01]]>><</button>></center>You remain frozen in place, heart beating fast as footsteps grow closer, foliage and shrubs crinkling and wavering as three men emerge from the thicket. You hope they won't notice you. But their eyes immediately flit to you. "There you are," the one in the middle says, triumphant, not breaking his stride while he draws his weapon, and his accomplices do the same. "And with <<print $c_sir.toUpperFirst()>> Cyril, no less. Two birds with one stone!" "What are you planning to do, soldiers?" Cyril asks, voice not betraying any of $c_his alarm, if $c_he feels any. "Surely Stanislas can't have asked you to kill the $Prince on sight. Let alone to kill <i>me</i>." The leader of the group narrows his eyes at $c_him. "You seem to know who I am," Cyril continues, unperturbed. "I would be much more valuable to Stanislas alive than dead. He will need gold and men for his military campaign. I have plenty of both." "You want me to believe that you would just give them away?" Cyril shrugs. "He could ransom me, I suppose." There's only silence for a while as the soldiers seem to weigh their options. "As for the $prince," Cyril says, and $c_he turns to give you a sort of indifferent smile, "I'm sure Stanislas would prefer to decide how to dispose of $him himself." You feel $c_his hand closing around your wrist, out of sight, and giving it a reassuring squeeze. Cold sweat rolls down your back, and you only swallow once you see their swords going back inside their scabbards. "Fine. Stanislas will decide what to do with the both of you." A roar catches your attention; from the thicket the three soldiers had emerged, five more appear, but this time, their arrival triggers a rush of relief in your chest. It's $wilfred and $w_his men. The trio fumbles to draw their weapons back out, but they're outnumbered and unprepared, and they're quickly and efficiently disposed of. $wilfred approaches you quickly, worry and anger lining $w_his every feature. "Are you alright?" $w_he asks, too loud. You nod, and $w_his eyes flit to Cyril, next to you on the ground. "$wilfred, you're a sight for sore eyes," $c_he says, voice shaky but cheerful. $wilfred looks back at you. "We have to leave, now. Stan's men are right behind us." <center><<button [[Next|Ch13_Fort_01]]>><</button>></center>You reach the fort after several hours of snaking through forests and laying low in thickets; you're thoroughly spent, every muscle aching and head throbbing when you finally enter the dusty courtyard. You get off your horse, and you blink, the world spinning around you. You feel sick to your stomach, and while you manage to fight back your overwhelming queasiness, you can't prevent your left knee from buckling under you. You barely manage to avoid crashing with all your weight to the floor, ending up sitting down on the ground while $wilfred rushes to your side. <ul> <li>[[″I'm fine. Just give me a moment.″->Ch13_Fort_02][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″Leave me alone!″->Ch13_Fort_02][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[I don't say anything, and just focus on breathing.->Ch13_Fort_02][$response = 3]]</li> </ul><<if ndef $textGroup>><<set $textGroup = 1>><</if>><<switch $textGroup>> <<case 1>><<if $response == 1>><<set $friendly to $friendly.fm(5)>>"I'm fine," you say, raising an appeasing hand. "Just give me a moment." <<elseif $response == 2>><<set $friendly to $friendly.fm(-5), $emotional to $emotional.fm(5)>>"Leave me alone!" you demand. <</if>>"Enemy soldiers!" someone shouts, and you hear $wilfred stand up next to you and get $w_his sword ready in one swift move. "We're just here to talk," the same voice promises. You don't recognize it, can't make out the face of its owner anyway. "There's no need for violence." "Speak, then," $wilfred snaps. "We just wanted to see the little $prince back home safely, didn't we, lads?" the man jeers. "After all, $he left in a hurry, leaving $his queen of a sister face down in the dirt, lying in her blood back in the royal gardens." A burst of laughter echoes, and $wilfred sneers. "I suggest you leave, before I order the archers to shoot you dead." "There will be no need for that, <<print $w_sir.toUpperFirst()>> $wilfred. We'll be leaving, now. We're looking forward to meeting you again, <<print $w_sir.toUpperFirst()>> $wilfred, along with the little child you're stubbornly following." Your heart pounding hard in your chest suddenly quietens. Its beating is now slow and steady, a strong rhythm that flows through you, soothing your every nerve. Your vision abruptly clears. <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<default>>There is no shred of lightheadedness left in you, and you can now easily stand up. There is a slow buzz, right under your skin, coursing through you; the feeling you've come to associate with Aether, raising goosebumps in its wake, making your hair stand on end at the back of your neck. It is not painful, however; quite the opposite, in fact. It runs through you, chasing off fatigue and hurt, leaving only one very clear idea in your mind as you turn towards the gates. Loud, steady in your ears, though muffled, as if underwater. You look around, and there is only darkness—the utter absence of anything to see, anything to feel. You're trapped in an unwanted state of rest, quieting your mind to protect it from the hardships you must still face. You push against it, unraveling the layers of unconsciousness, shrugging off the weight of fatigue pulling you down, and you choose not to take heed of the pain that warns you not to step out of this cocoon of nothingness. You cast it all away, and emerge. <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<case 2>>When you next draw a breath, it stings; like the first breath you have breathed in hours, cool air expanding your lungs and burning your throat. You cough yourself awake. "$mcname_cyril," a voice says. Footsteps ring against wooden flooring, closing in on you. You sit up on instinct, coughing still, and a hand at your back soon steadies you. Eventually, you manage to breathe easy again, throat still aching but nothing preventing you from inhaling the smoke scented air around you. You blink your eyes open, wiping away the dampness at their corners that blurs your vision. "Here," you hear next to you, and a glass materializes before you. You take it, wincing at the shock of cold against your burning skin. Still, you want—<i>need</i> to drink, and you bring the tall glass to your lips, gingerly tipping it back. Water washes inside your mouth, and in that moment, you could swear you have never tasted anything sweeter. You swallow it, feeling it cool down your insides, bringing back a semblance of calm normalcy to the harsh sensations that keep attacking you. The empty glass is softly pulled from your fingers, smooth surface slipping against them, and you follow its path, turning your head to your right. <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<default>>Blond hair, worried hazel eyes against a skin paler than it should be. "I don't know," you answer truthfully, voice wavering. You hear $c_him let out the smallest sigh.<<elseif $response == 4>>"I'm… fine." Your head is still pounding, but not painfully so. Or perhaps you've simply grown accustomed to the feeling. The fire crackling sings a slow song you feel yourself sink into. It blocks everything out; the pain, the hurt, the regret; like wool stuffing in your ears. The bed is warm, comfortable, and you let yourself close your painful eyes a moment. Just a moment. <<if $interest_will == true && $aff_will >= 60>>You don't feel yourself slipping into slumber; but as your consciousness recedes, you sense a hand at the side of your cheek. It wipes away a tear, <<if $hair_length == "shoulder-length" || $hair_length == "long">>pushes your hair away from your face, <</if>>and pulls the covers over your chest. <</if>>A door closes, and you allow yourself to fall asleep. <center><<button [[The next morning...|Ch15_01]]>><</button>></center><<set $ch14_grief_ariana = true>>"She was my only sister." You look down at your hands. You note that your fingertips are a little red. "And now I will never see her again… I loved her." Your voice breaks on the last word, and you bite back a sob. <ul> <li>[[Let it out.->Ch14_W_cry]]</li> <li>[[Hold it back.->Ch14_W_hold]]</li> </ul>"My parents loved her so much. It was always Ariana this, Ariana that. The Gifted Princess. Power not seen in generations. So full of herself. I <i>hated</i> her." When you look at $wilfred, $w_he is mostly expressionless, with only the barest hint of concern in $w_his gaze. "Did you really?" "Yes, I really did. She got even worse once she became Queen. Ordering me and everybody else around… She must have been having a grand old time." "She was not," $wilfred cuts you off, but $w_his tone isn't biting, just matter-of-factly. "She was strong, and she took it all in stride. She did the best she could, but that doesn't mean any of it was easy for her. She would have made a great, powerful queen. Losing her is a blow I'm not sure we'll be able to recover from." <<if $aff_will < 40>>You glare at $w_him, and $w_he gives you a placid stare back.<<else>>"Thanks for the vote of confidence." <<if $aff_will < 60>>$w_He doesn't reply.<<else>>"This wasn't a strike against you. I apologize."<</if>><</if>> <<include Ch14_W_03_DL>><<if ndef $textGroup>><<set $textGroup = 1>><</if>><<switch $textGroup>> <<case 1>><<set $cried = true, $emotional to $emotional.fm(10)>>You stop fighting it back, and your eyes overflow with tears, streaking down your face in wet paths of pain. You cry, chest bursting with an ache you didn't know you could even feel this strongly. It rips you apart, a red-hot sting that shreds your heart. There is a warm hand on your arm, grounding you as you shake with sorrow. It takes you a few minutes to recompose yourself, and you feel drained and spent afterwards, sinking back into the pillows behind you. <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<default>>Your breathing evens out, after a while. You sniffle absently, head pounding but not painful. The fire crackling sings a slow song you feel yourself sink into. It blocks everything out, the pain, the hurt, the regret, like wool stuffing in your ears. The bed is warm, comfortable, and you let yourself close your painful eyes a moment. Just a moment. <<if $interest_will == true && $aff_will >= 60>>You don't feel yourself slipping into slumber; but as your consciousness recedes, you sense a hand at the side of your cheek. It wipes away a tear, <<if $hair_length == "shoulder-length" || $hair_length == "long">>pushes your hair away from your face, <</if>>and pulls the covers over your chest. <</if>>A door closes, and you allow yourself to fall asleep. <<unset $textGroup>><center><<button [[The next morning...|Ch15_01]]>><</button>></center><</switch>><<if def $textGroup>><<set $textGroup += 1>><</if>>You bite it back, swallowing around the tightness in your throat, blinking away the tears you refuse to shed. It hurts, in your eyes, in your throat, in your heart; grief pressing down on you and making even drawing a breath painful. There is a warm hand on your arm, grounding you as you fight back the sorrow. It takes a few minutes to recompose yourself, and you feel broken afterwards, sinking back into the pillows behind you. <center><<button [[Next|Ch14_W_04]]>><</button>></center><div class="header"> <div id="header-text" data-passage="header-text"></div> <div id="function-menu"> <span id="menu"></span> <span id="back"></span> <span id="settings"></span> <span id="saves"></span> <span </div><<if $DisplayTitle == true>><span class="title"><p style="font-family:'Cinzel'">Arcadie: Second-Born</p></span><</if>><<nobr>><<set $StatusOn = false, $serious = 100 - $playful, $antagonistic = $childgender of the King and Queen of the Kingdom of Arcadie.<<elseif $name_set == true>>You are $Prince $mcname d'Arcadie.<<else>>You are the youngest $childgender of the King and Queen of the Kingdom of Arcadie.<</if>><<if $chara_create == true>> You have $skin_tone skin, $hair_length $hair_color hair and $eye_color eyes.<</if>> <div class="separator"> !Personality </div> <div <</nobr>><</if>><center><b>Writing and coding</b> [[Sofia D.|https://sofia-d-asb.tumblr.com]] <b>Design</b> Based on templates by [[a.w. morgan|https://awmorgan.itch.io/twine-sugarcube-template]] & [[brushmen|https://awmorgan.itch.io/twine-sugarcube-template]] <b>Icons</b> [[Font Awesome|https://fontawesome.com/]] <b>Beta testers</b> Alicia Aviva Blazingdragon ChairmanMeow Eiwynn eldensalkeld Builder|https://github.com/lazerwalker/twine-app-builder]] Version 1.0.2 <b>"Arcadie: Second-Born"</b> is Copyright 2022 Sofia D. All rights reserved.</center> <center><<button "Return" $return>><</button>></center><<set $DisplayTitle = false>><center><a data-passage="Ch01_01" class="link-internal link-image"> <img src="img/asb-title.png" alt="Arcadie: Second-Born" style="max-width: 100%"> </a></center>Please be advised that <b>Arcadie: Second-Born</b> is intended for a mature audience. It contains the following: <ul> <li>Violence</li> <li>Character death</li> <li>Non-explicit descriptions of blood and injuries</li> <li>Mentions and use of alcohol</li> <li>Mildly-explicit, optional sexual content</li> </ul><<set $gamestarted = true, $DisplayTitle = true, $StatusOn = true>>"Today will be a good day." You look your older sister's way as she loudly shares her morning sentiment, her green eyes sparkling with anticipation. Her lady-in-waiting is busy circling her, fastening the belt attached to a sword's black scabbard around Ariana's hips. Your sister seems older than her twenty-five years of age, once dressed in the official Arcadian army uniform: a deep blue jacket with golden buttons and trim, its velvet shining softly under the warm sunlight slitting through the curtains swaying before the open windows. Her long legs are clad in the same dark color, a double gold line descending from hips to knees, where it disappears into polished black leather boots. What visually sets her apart from other officers of your army is the crest over her heart: a stylized embroidery of a rose, marking her as a member of the Royal family: the Princess of Arcadie, next in line to the throne. The lady-in-waiting slides behind Ariana, and clips on her shoulders the golden stripes that mark her as a high-ranking officer in the Kingdom's army. Seemingly done with her task, she then retreats in silence, bowing respectfully, and leaves the changing room. Ariana spins to take in her appearance in a tall, gold-fringed mirror. You twist around to do the same, facing your reflection clad in much the same manner as Ariana, the stripes on your shoulders silver instead of gold, marking you as an officer, albeit of a lower rank. The handle of your sword is not as embellished as hers either, her weapon being a family heirloom while yours, while expertly crafted, is more run-of-the-mill. As you look at yourself, you raise and run your hand through… <ul> <li>[[...your very short hair.->Ch01_02][$hair_length = "very short"]]</li> <li>[[...your short hair.->Ch01_02][$hair_length = "short"]]</li> <li>[[...your shoulder-length hair.->Ch01_02][$hair_length = "shoulder-length"]]</li> <li>[[...your long hair.->Ch01_02][$hair_length = "long"]]</li> </ul>Its shade is… <ul> <li>[[Blond, just like your mother's.->Ch01_03][$hair_color = "blond"]]</li> <li>[[Light brown, like your sister's.->Ch01_03][$hair_color = "light brown"]]</li> <li>[[Brown, like your father's.->Ch01_03][$hair_color = "brown"]]</li> <li>[[Black.->Ch01_03][$hair_color = "black"]]</li> <li>[[Red.->Ch01_03][$hair_color = "red"]]</li> </ul><<set $StatusOn = false>><<if $gamestarted == true>><<if $ch12_ariana_dd == false>><div class="separator"> !Ariana d'Arcadie </div> Your older <<if $ariana_queen == false>>sister, the Crown Princess of Arcadie.<<else>>sister, the Queen of Arcadie.<</if>> <div class="stat-bar-container"> <div class="stat-bar-overlay-left">Affection <<= $aff_ariana.toFixed(0)>>%</div> <div class="stat-bar-overlay-right"> $blank</div> <div class="stat-bar" id="ariana-stat"></div></div> <</if>> <<if $met_will == true>><div class="separator"> !$wilfred Steinmann </div> The Commander in the South. <div class="stat-bar-container"> <div class="stat-bar-overlay-left">Affection <<= $aff_will.toFixed(0)>>%</div> <div class="stat-bar-overlay-right"> $blank</div> <div class="stat-bar" id="will-stat"></div></div> <</if>> <<if $met_stan == true>><div class="separator"> !Stanislas Duval </div> The Commander in the North. <div class="stat-bar-container"> <div class="stat-bar-overlay-left">Affection <<= $aff_stan.toFixed(0)>>%</div> <div class="stat-bar-overlay-right"> $blank</div> <div class="stat-bar" id="stan-stat"></div></div> <</if>> <<if $met_cyril == true>><div class="separator"> !Cyril Lavignac </div> The Commander in the West, and Leader of the Peacekeeping Force. <div class="stat-bar-container"> <div class="stat-bar-overlay-left">Affection <<= $aff_cyril.toFixed(0)>>%</div> <div class="stat-bar-overlay-right"> $blank</div> <div class="stat-bar" id="cyril-stat"></div></div> <</if>> <<if $met_nath == true>><div class="separator"> !Nathaniel Langard </div> Your Aether advisor, of sorts. <div class="stat-bar-container"> <div class="stat-bar-overlay-left">Affection <<= $aff_nath.toFixed(0)>>%</div> <div class="stat-bar-overlay-right"> $blank</div> <div class="stat-bar" id="nath-stat"></div></div> <</if>> <<else>>The <b>Relationships Screen</b> will be available once the story has begun.<</if>> <center><<button "Return">><<script>>Engine.backward()<</script>><<set $StatusOn = true>><</button>></center>Your eyes are… <ul> <li>[[Blue.->Ch01_04][$eye_color = "blue"]]</li> <li>[[Gray.->Ch01_04][$eye_color = "gray"]]</li> <li>[[Green, just like Ariana's and your mother's.->Ch01_04][$eye_color = "green"]]</li> <li>[[Hazel.->Ch01_04][$eye_color = "hazel"]]</li> <li>[[Brown, much like your father's.->Ch01_04][$eye_color = "brown"]]</li> <li>[[Black.->Ch01_04][$eye_color = "black"]]</li> </ul>The reason both of you are dressed in official army garb is that you have been invited to attend an important meeting: two envoys from the country bordering yours to the north are arriving today. The Kingdom of Arcadie has been embroiled in skirmishes with them for decades, if not centuries now, fighting over fertile lands that both parties claim to be theirs. There is now an end in sight to the conflict, as today's meeting has been set for the signing of a peace treaty. Your sister calling you snaps you out of your thoughts. <ul> <li>[[″You're looking dazzling, little sister,″ she teases, a bright smile on her lips.->Ch01_05][$childgender = "daughter"]]</li> <li>[[″You're looking mighty handsome, young man,″ she says in a joking tone.->Ch01_05][$mcgender = "male", $childgender = "son", $brother = "brother", $he = "he", $He = "He", $his = "his", $His = "His", $his_p = "his", $His_p = "His", $him = "him", $Him = "Him", $boy = "boy", $man = "man", $prince = "prince", $Prince = "Prince", $heir = "heir", $king = "king", $King = "King", $handsome = "handsome", $himself = "himself"]]</li> </ul><<if $mcgender == "male">>"You're looking mighty handsome, young man," Ariana says in a joking tone.<<else>>"You're looking dazzling, little sister," Ariana teases, a bright smile pulling on her lips.<</if>> <ul> <li>[[″You're not looking so bad yourself.″->Ch01_05a][$aff_ariana to $aff_ariana.fm(5), $playful to $playful.fm(5), $friendly to $friendly.fm(5)]]</li> <li>[[″Stop it,″ I mutter shyly.->Ch01_05b][$timid to $timid.fm(5), $emotional to $emotional.fm(5)]]</li> <li>[[″Thank you,″ I say with a smile.->Ch01_05c][$aff_ariana to $aff_ariana.fm(5), $friendly to $friendly.fm(5)]]</li> <li>[[″Stop wasting time.″->Ch01_05d][$aff_ariana to $aff_ariana.fm(-5), $timid to $timid.fm(-5), $diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(-5)]]</li> </ul><<set $gamestarted = false, $met_will = false, $met_stan = false, $met_cyril = false, $met_nath = false>><i>Would you like to set the genders of the two main Romance Options you will encounter? You can also decide to set their genders only when first meeting the characters. <ul> <li>[[Set them to Male.->Ch00][$ro_gender_picked = true]]</li> <li>[[Set them to Female.->Ch00][$ro_gender_picked = true, $will_gender = "female", $wilfred = "Willeen", $w_he = "she", $w_his = "her", $w_his_p = "hers", $w_him = "her", $w_boy = "girl", $w_He = "She", $w_His = "Her", $w_His_p = "Hers", $w_Him = "Her", $w_sir = "Lady", $w_man = "woman", $w_handsome = "beautiful", $w_himself = "herself", $cyril_gender = "female", $c_he = "she", $c_his = "her", $c_his_p = "hers", $c_him = "her", $c_boy = "girl", $c_man = "woman", $c_brother = "sister", $c_sir = "Lady", $c_He = "She", $c_His = "Her", $c_His_p = "Her", $c_Him = "Her", $c_handsome = "beautiful", $c_himself = "herself"]]</li> <li>[[Select gender on first encounter.->Ch00]]</li> </ul></i><span style="color:#cea135"> !Navigation </span> The <span id="menu" style="font-family:'FontAwesome Solid'"></span> Menu is at the top left corner of the screen. The <span id="back" style="font-family:'FontAwesome Solid'"></span> Back button allows you to return to the previous screen. The <span id="settings" style="font-family:'FontAwesome Solid'"></span> Settings button allows you to change the font, its size, select the light or night mode for easier reading. The <span id="saves" style="font-family:'FontAwesome Solid'"></span> Save button allows you to Load and Save your game. The game autosaves automatically. The <span id="restart" style="font-family:'FontAwesome Solid'"></span> Restart button will reset the game and return you to the main menu. The <span id="header-fullscreen-button" style="font-family:'FontAwesome Solid'"></span> Fullscreen button allows you to toggle between Fullscreen and Windowed mode. The Stats and Relationships menus are at the bottom of the screen. <span style="color:#cea135"> !Stats </span> Two types of Stats are tracked in <b>Arcadie: Second-Born</b>: stats pertaining to your <b>Personality</b>, and those pertaining to your <b>Skills</b>. Your <b>Personality</b> dictates how the characters, and the world at large, view and may react to you. There are no checks associated with your Personality that can lead to failure. Your proficiency at specific <b>Skills</b> dictates your success or failure at the relevant skill checks. <span style="color:#cea135"> !Romance </span> Triggering a romance requires that you signify your interest either explicitly to the character you intend to romance, or implictly through specific options in the game. There is no need to select all and every flirt option available; you should only select those that make sense for the particular character you are playing. Romantic subplots can be successfully triggered at various points of the story. <center><<button "Return" $return>><</button>></center>"You're not looking so bad yourself," you reply. "Thank you," she says slowly, gliding her hand through her shoulder-length, straight hair. The light brown strands slip lazily over her shoulders. Its color pairs well with the gold trim of her uniform. She turns to open the tall white doors of the changing room. <<include Ch01_06>>"Stop it," you mutter, the tip of your ears becoming warm. "No need to be shy!" she says, looking far too amused by your blushing. She then turns to open the tall white doors of the changing room. <<include Ch01_06>> "Thank you," you say with a smile. A happy smile of her own tugs her lips high. She then turns to open the tall white doors of the changing room. <<include Ch01_06>> "Stop wasting time," you say, eager to get this over with. "You're no fun at all," she sighs, then turns to open the tall white doors of the changing room. <<include Ch01_06>> "Let's go, we don't want to be late." She strides out into the wooden-floored hallway. A brisk walk allows you to catch up to her, and you naturally fall into step beside her. The hallway is well-lit, tall windows on its right side letting the sunlight paint warm and yellow rectangles on the cinnamon-colored wood. It is bustling with activity, the castle staff zigzagging through the corridors, undoubtedly busy getting everything ready for the foreign envoys. You notice Ariana looking around, her eyes searching for someone amongst the people wandering around the castle. "Victor," she calls loudly, not breaking her stride, singling out a man in a black and white uniform. He jumps, his thin black mustache twitching, and holds a round metal tray in front of him like a shield. <<if $ro_gender_picked == true>><<include Ch01_07>><<else>> <ul> <li>[[″Where is Sir Wilfred?″ she asks.->Ch01_07]]</li> <li>[[″Where is Lady Willeen?″ she asks.->Ch01_07][$will_gender = "female", $wilfred = "Willeen", $w_he = "she", $w_his = "her", $w_his_p = "hers", $w_him = "her", $w_boy = "girl", $w_He = "She", $w_His = "Her", $w_His_p = "Hers", $w_Him = "Her", $w_sir = "Lady", $w_man = "woman", $w_handsome = "beautiful", $w_himself = "herself"]]</li> </ul><</if>>"Where is $w_sir $wilfred?" she asks. "In the courtyard, Your Highness," he quickly stammers out as you both pass him by. "Thank you," she replies with a nod. She turns right at the following corner, and descends the stairs leading to the courtyard. Ariana has always been headstrong, and a little brusque. She's quick to command and order people around, her status as heiress to the throne enough reason for her to do so. Maybe part of it is what makes her an effective leader; despite her relatively young age, she has already distinguished herself as an officer in several victorious battles. These past few months, she's more often than not in the field rather than in the castle. $w_sir $wilfred, Commander of your armies in the South, has been assigned to her instruction in the art of war, and so Ariana has lately been a regular part of the forces defending your Kingdom's southern lands. <center><<button [[Next|Ch01_07b]]>><</button>></center>For as long as you can remember, your parents have never stopped putting Ariana on a pedestal, their pride in her proficiency on the battlefield only second to their exhilaration once it was discovered that she has the Gift. For the first time in four generations, someone has shown themselves capable of taming Aether, the invisible mystical force of your realm. Every member of your family is able to weave a bit of magic; you, for instance, could ignite a candle, should you focus hard enough; but Ariana's mastery is supposed to be miles above what anyone else has been able to achieve in recent memory. She of course cannot reenact what heroes of old supposedly accomplished, leveling entire cities and splitting oceans open through the sheer power of their will, but you have seen her throw a soldier in full armor to the ground with barely a wave of her arm. While your parents' focus is without a doubt mainly trained on your sister, they have not neglected you either; you've always had access to the best instructors in the Kingdom, all your whims granted without discussion, gotten any and all material items you've ever fancied. You've been at leisure to pursue your heart's desires in almost all matters, and are a lot more free with your time than Ariana is. After all, <i>she</i> is the heiress to the throne. You are not. <ul> <li>[[Ariana is doing the best she can, and so am I, in my own way.->Ch01_07c][$diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(5)]]</li> <li>[[I'm quite happy away from the spotlight. I enjoy having free reign to have fun.->Ch01_07c][$playful += 5, $involved -= 5]]</li> <li>[[I wish my parents gave me more responsibilities, but my freedom gives me time to focus on developing my skills.->Ch01_07c][$playful -= 5, $involved += 5]]</li> <li>[[I enjoy my alone time, so I'm perfectly fine with how things are.->Ch01_07c][$timid to $timid.fm(5), $involved to $involved.fm(-5)]]</li> <li>[["I don't necessarily want to be the " + $heir + ", but I wish people paid more attention to me."->Ch01_07c][$timid to $timid.fm(-5)]]</li> <li>[[This frustrates me. I could do so much more for the Kingdom, if only they'd let me.->Ch01_07c][$emotional to $emotional.fm(5), $involved to $involved.fm(5), $WantThrone = true]]</li> <li>[["If only I was the " + $heir + " instead of Ariana."->Ch01_07c][$WantThrone = true, $diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(-5), $involved to $involved.fm(5)]]</li> <li>[[I don't care either way.->Ch01_07c][$involved to $involved.fm(-5)]]</li> </ul>You have been using your free time to mainly focus on… <ul> <li>[[Studying the science of government and political principles, as well as military strategies and tactics.->Ch01_07d][$politics += 50, $sword += 10]]</li> <li>[[Training in sword fighting.->Ch01_07d][$politics += 10, $sword += 50]]</li> </ul>You've also given some of your focus to… <ul> <<if $politics < 50>><li>[[Studying the science of government and political principles, as well as military strategies and tactics.->Ch01_07e][$politics += 10]]</li><</if>> <<if $sword < 50>><li>[[Training in sword fighting.->Ch01_07e][$sword += 10]]</li><</if>> <li>[[Reading books on Aether.->Ch01_07e][$aether += 20, $aether_2ndSkill = true]]</li> </ul><<if $politics >= 50>>You have been using your free time to focus on the study of the science of government and political principles. You have a good grasp of the inner workings of your Kingdom and its relationship with the neighboring countries. You've also studied military battle strategies and tactics extensively, and while you can definitely wield a sword, you are not the strongest of fighters. <<elseif $sword >= 50>>You have been using your free time to focus on your swordsmanship. You are a skilled and competent fighter, and more often that not, you emerge victorious in any sword duel you may take part in. You know a little about the inner workings of your Kingdom, and its relationship with the neighboring countries, and have studied some military battle strategies and tactics. <</if>><<if $aether >= 20>>And while you may not have the Gift, Aether is still a power that piques your interest; you often peruse books on the mystical power, and try to hone your Aethereal abilities, such as they are. <</if>>You glimpse Ariana awaiting you at the bottom of the staircase. She looks up as you scale down the stairs, beaming at you with a toothy grin that brightens her entire face. <ul> <li>[[I smile back at her. I love my sister.->Ch01_07f1][$aff_ariana to $aff_ariana.fm(40), $friendly to $friendly.fm(5)]]</li> <li>[[I smile at her. "I want you to be more involved in the Kingdom's affairs. I'm sure you would do a great job." Her green eyes twinkle with pride, and she strides ahead, her boots clicking against the stone-paved path. <<include Ch01_08>> "It's a good thing you're attending the meeting," she says. "I'd like you to be more involved in the Kingdom's affairs. I'm pretty sure you would do a great job." She then strides ahead, her boots clicking against the stone-paved path. <<include Ch01_08>>"Bored already?" she says. "Come on, this is important; it's not everyday we sign a <i>peace</i> treaty. She then strides ahead, her boots clicking against the stone-paved path. <<include Ch01_08>>"Ah, there's that <i>beautiful</i> frown of yours, little $brother." Or is it having to do something useful, for a change?" She is clearly trying to rile you up, and it seems to entertain her to no end. <ul> <li>[[I ignore her.->Ch01_07f4a][$emotional to $emotional.fm(-5)]]</li> <li>[[″Don't flatter yourself.″->Ch01_07f4b][$timid to $timid.fm(-5), $friendly to $friendly.fm(-5)]]</li> <li>[[″What good looks? The sun shines brightly on the stone floor and walls, and you squint while your eyes gradually get used to the daylight. The courtyard is buzzing with people, soldiers in blue and staff in black and white coming and going, each focused on their respective tasks. From here, one can readily access the castle wing housing the throne room on its ground level, and today's meeting room on its first floor. The stables are also within easy reach, your royal steeds being tended to when you're not riding them. The lavish castle gardens are a short walk away; with the arrival of spring, flowers have begun blooming a few weeks ago. At the center of the courtyard is a large oak tree, its branches heavy with leaves offering some reprieve from the scorching sun above. You and Ariana come to a stop in its shade. "There are a lot more soldiers than usual," Ariana notes. "They're not soldiers from the castle; I don't recognize them." You follow her gaze, and scrutinize the numerous men and women in armor around you. She is right; you don't know most of them. <<if $politics >= 20>>"The Commander in the North, Sir Stanislas," you say. "He came along with the envoys, didn't he? These are probably men from his garrison." Ariana nods pensively. "Makes sense. You're probably right." <<else>>"Come to think of it, Stanislas probably brought his men along," Ariana surmises, fingers below her chin, then turns to face you. Discussing the treaty without the Kalltland envoys present should be instructive to both of you." <center><<button [[Next|Ch01_12]]>><</button>></center><<set $met_stan = true>>The three of you proceed to the northern castle wing. After climbing two flights of stairs, you find yourself in a long hallway, its wooden floor covered by a red carpet. A man dressed in the same uniform as $wilfred is standing in front of a pair of closed doors. He's tall, <<if $will_gender == "male">>less so than Wilfred, <</if>>and there is a softness to his face and to his obsidian eyes, almost hidden under his bangs. His hair is black as ink, its color almost shifting to blue under the sunlight seeping through the hallway's windows. You recognize Stanislas Duval, Commander of your armies in the North, as evident from the emblem sewn over his shoulder in gold thread; a five-pointed star, looming over a snowy peak. His mouth curves into a smile as your group approaches. "Hello, old friend," he says. "Stan." $wilfred strides ahead of you. $w_He catches the extended arm of the <<if $will_gender == "male">>other <</if>>man, clasping him into a brief half hug, then takes a step back, facing you again. "Your Highnesses," Stanislas greets you, still smiling. He flicks his dark, gentle eyes back to $wilfred. "The envoys are almost done with their tour of the gardens. I have been told they had never seen so many flowers in one place before." "Good for them," $wilfred says, voice dripping with sarcasm, then reaches for the heavy door. Stanislas stops $w_him. <center><<button [[Next|Ch01_13]]>><</button>></center>"What's your take on this meeting?" he asks, voice lower. You can still hear him, but only because the hallway is otherwise quiet. "Wasn't this your idea?" $wilfred keeps a hand on the door's handle, $w_his back to you as $w_he faces Stanislas. "It was." Stanislas smiles. "But I know how little you think of Kalltland." "I think very little of anyone opposing us. Though I admit, Kalltland is the worst of them all." Stanislas's smile falters slightly. "Truthfully," $wilfred continues, "this treaty is far more to their advantage than ours. We're ceding a few northern lands, and in exchange, they agree to put a stop to their pathetic raids. But what is really needed to resolve this issue once and for all, would be to lay siege to their underground cities, with enough manpower to block them off, and starve them out." "Are you saying your way of resolving this 'issue' would be to exterminate them?" $wilfred acquiesces with a nod. "But I understand that resources for this type of operation are better spent elsewhere." "I hope you're not trying to implement any of that in the southern territories," Stanislas says, and his otherwise gentle features contort with disapproval. "Of course not. The southern tribes know to stay down when they've been beaten. Kalltlanders, on the other hand…" $w_He waves a dismissive hand. "They just keep coming back for more, don't they? Fortunately for them, <i>I'm</i> no longer Commander in the North, <i>you</i> are. Which is why we're here, to sign a peace treaty." "Indeed we are," Ariana interjects, stepping between them. "Let's get on with it, shall we?" $wilfred opens the double door for her, and she heads inside. Stanislas watches her go under his eyelashes, before looking back at $wilfred. "I'm impressed you managed to persuade them to sign anything," $wilfred admits, a hand resting absently on the pommel of $w_his sword, the other still on the door's handle. "Never thought they were the type to be talked down." Stanislas gives $w_him a small smile. "They can be. You just need to present them with the right argument." He opens his mouth to add something but seems to think better of it, his lips snapping back shut. $wilfred nods, then heads inside the meeting room. <center><<button [[Next|Ch01_14]]>><</button>></center>Stanislas watches you with a friendly smile. It's just the two of you in the hallway, now. <ul> <li>[[I should talk a bit with Stanislas. Soldiers are dotted around the room, your family members are seated at the long, dark mahogany table, while the rest of the attendance is crowding around the heavy piece of furniture. $w_sir $wilfred stands to its right, hands over the back of a chair as $w_he scans through papers laid out in front of $w_him, over the table's surface. Stanislas moves to its left side, placing himself behind a chair, and electing to remain on his feet. Your parents are at its very end, tall windows behind their backs, talking with your sister, who is half sitting on the table's edge. Soldiers in full armor—you count nine of them—stand perfectly still close to the gray walls. <ul> <li>[["I strike a conversation with " + $w_sir + " " + $wilfred + "."->Ch01_17]]</li> <li>[["I don't want to talk to " + $w_sir + " " + $wilfred + ". Usually, the only meetings we hold are meant to discuss terms of surrender. We're very good at waging and winning wars." He looks aside, pensive. "I suppose emptying our enemies' coffers is as good a way as any to keep ours full." <ul> <li>[[″Our fertile lands are the reason other countries attack us.″->Ch01_15Stan_1a][$playful to $playful.fm(-5), $involved to $involved.fm(5)]]</li> <li>[[″Our Kingdom would benefit from brokering more peace treaties.″->Ch01_15Stan_1b][$diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(5), $aff_stan to $aff_stan.fm(30), $pacifist to $pacifist.fm(10)]]</li> <li>[[″Don't you know? 'It is better to be feared than loved'.″->Ch01_15Stan_1c][$playful to $playful.fm(5), $diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(-5), $timid to $timid.fm(-5), $pacifist to $pacifist.fm(-10), $aff_stan to $aff_stan.fm(-10)]]</li> <li>[[″I'm not really interested in politics.″->Ch01_15Stan_1d][$playful to $playful.fm(5), $diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(-5), $involved to $involved.fm(-5)]]</li> <li>[["″I am surprised you'd say this to me, of all people. I am the " + $Prince + ", after all.″"->Ch01_15Stan_1e][$playful to $playful.fm(-5), $diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(5), $aff_stan to $aff_stan.fm(10)]]</li> <li>[[″What kind of talk is that?″ I ask disapprovingly.->Ch01_15Stan_1f][$diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(-5)]]</li> <li>[[″I don't care what you think.″->Ch01_15Stan_1g][$diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(-10), $timid to $timid.fm(-5), $aff_stan to $aff_stan.fm(-30)]]</li> </ul> "Our fertile lands are the reason other countries attack us," you respond. "We're not the aggressors in these conflicts." "Surely you know better than I our Kingdom's history. Our fertile lands have been conquered in blood." He suddenly seems wistful, his smile subsiding. "The several thousand dead buried under our feet probably help make our lands so bountiful." You're surprised. These are not words you would have expected a commanding officer to speak, least of all in front of you. "Anyway." Stanislas's smile is but a shadow. "We should get inside." He beckons you as he enters the meeting room. With nothing else to do in the hallway, you follow. <center><<button [[Next|Ch01_16]]>><</button>></center>You pointedly ignore Stanislas, walking past him and the still open door. <<include Ch01_16>>"Our Kingdom would benefit from brokering more peace treaties," you respond. "We have been waging war for centuries, fighting over fertile lands. Now is the time to try a different approach." He blinks twice. "I'm… surprised you'd think so," he says, a shade of doubt in his voice. <ul> <li>[[″Pleasantly, I hope.″->Ch01_15Stan_1b1][$friendly to $friendly.fm(5)]]</li> <li>[[″There are far more benefits to peace than war.″->Ch01_15Stan_1b2][$pacifist to $pacifist.fm(5)]]</li> <li>[[I smirk. ″I'm full of surprises...″->Ch01_15Stan_1b3][$playful to $playful.fm(5), $flirt_stan += 1, $timid to $timid.fm(-10)]]</li> </ul>"Pleasantly, I hope," you say with a smile. "Definitely. It's…" He pauses, suddenly apologetic. "…rather unfortunate, that your parents and sister are of a different mind." "I'll make them come around." He stares at you, black eyes looking gray like steel under the sunlight. "Under other circumstances…" he begins, frowns and looks away. He seems utterly displeased, though you're not sure about what. "We should get inside," he says, his eyes on you again. He enters the meeting room and, with nothing left to do in the hallway, you follow. <center><<button [[Next|Ch01_16]]>><</button>></center>"There are far more benefits to peace than war." "I agree. It's…" He pauses, suddenly contrite. "…unfortunate, that your parents and sister are of a different mind." "I'll make them come around." He stares at you, black eyes looking gray like steel under the sunlight. "Under other circumstances…" he begins, frowns and looks away. He seems utterly displeased, though you're not sure about what. "We should get inside," he says, his eyes on you again. He enters the meeting room and, with nothing left to do in the hallway, you follow. <center><<button [[Next|Ch01_16]]>><</button>></center>"I'm <i>full</i> of surprises," you say with a smirk. "Should you desire, I'll grant you a chance at unveiling each and every one of them." Stanislas's eyes widen at your sudden proximity, at your suggestive tone. This close, you can see they're rather gray than truly black, mesmerizing in the sunlight. "Under other circumstances…" he begins, frowns and looks away. He beckons you as he enters the meeting room. You remember still, how you would tuck together under the covers in the middle of winter, and how she would read the lines of heavy tomes before dropping them aside; how, as she stroked your hair while you drifted to sleep, she would recite them from memory, filling your dreams with grandiose battles and glorious victories. While he is indeed the King, and not simply the Prince-Consort, as your mother wished him to have equal say to her in the Realm's affairs, you know he does not care overmuch to exert any sort of power over the Kingdom, deferring to your mother in almost all things. He much prefers filling his time with intellectual and artistic pursuits. Gardening is a great pleasure of his, and you knew that to find him on a sunny day, one only needed to visit the castle gardens. There, you would talk of nothing and everything, and he would listen intently to your words, always ready to offer encouragement if you were to tell of some issue or another. While it stung to witness the glimmer of pride in his eye every time Ariana came into the conversation, you knew that your father loved you, too. <center><<button [[Next|Ch01_20]]>><</button>></center>Your parents are deep in conversation when you arrive. "Nine soldiers inside the room, two of our Commanders, Ariana and $mcname, who can both hold their own in a fight… This is a bit excessive, for the signing of a peace treaty with two unarmed envoys, isn't it?" Your mother is unfazed by your father's concerns, hands laced in front of her. "I trust Sir Stanislas," she says. "He's the one behind this peace treaty, yet he still requested that his men ensure our protection during the meeting and afterwards. Let's not be naive, Lavic. "The worst they could do is try to kill us with their bare hands." "Ariana," Queen Serene says, a warning in her voice.
