"The whole Kingdom is at our back." <ul> <li>[["″Good luck out there, " + $mcwill + ".″"->Ch11_NightWill1]]</li> <li>[[″Leave some of that optimism for the rest of us.″->Ch11_NightWill2]]</li> <li>[[I nod.->Ch11_NightWill3]]</li> </ul><<else>>You hear Cyril's steps on the lush grass before you see $c_him, and when your eyes meet, $c_he parts with a smile. <<if $RanAwayCyril == true>>"There you are. You're one of the fastest runners I've ever known." $c_He stops next to you, $c_his expression turning grave. <</if>>"This is the moment we've been waiting for," $c_he says. "It's time you retook your castle and avenged your parents' death, $mcname_cyril." <ul> <li>[[″Be careful out there.″->Ch11_NightCyril1]]</li> <li>[[″I'd rather not, but it seems I don't have a choice.″->Ch11_NightCyril2]]</li> <li>[[I nod.->Ch11_NightCyril3]]</li> </ul><</if>>Cyril is rather easy to spot: $c_his blond hair catches your eye almost as soon as you start looking for $c_him, finding $c_him amidst $c_his lieutenants in a loose circle. As you approach, you catch fragments of a conversation not really meant for you, details you have no knowledge of, the order in which archers should draw and loose and when the ladders should be deployed, and whether or not Sylvain would be able to operate the battering ram or if he should be replaced by Nathalie's unit. Five pairs of eyes focus on you when you're only a few feet away, and Cyril <<if $aff_cyril < 60>>turns to face you. "Your Highness," $c_he says, $c_his smile polite. "We're all looking forward to fighting by your side, tomorrow." <ul> <li>[[″So am I.″->Ch11_Cyril_End_a]]</li> <li>[[I shrug.->Ch11_Cyril_End_b]]</li> <li>[[″I'm not looking forward to it.″->Ch11_Cyril_End_c]]</li> </ul><<else>>swivels to face you, casting you a charming smile in the process. "Carry on without me," $c_he tosses behind $c_him, "I will be but a minute." $c_He doesn't stop when $c_he reaches your level, <<if $interest_cyril == true>>catches your elbow in a soft grasp and guides you to a nearby, empty tent.<<else>>and walks with you until you've reached a nearby, empty tent.<</if>> Once you're inside, $c_he <<if $interest_cyril == true>>lets go of your arm, still smiling as $c_he <</if>>asks, "Is there anything you need, $mcname_cyril?" <ul> <li>[[″Not really. As soon as you've closed the door behind you, a malaise overtakes you; that same unpleasant buzzing you felt this morning, vibrating in your very bones and giving a metallic tang to your own tongue. Ariana turns towards you, candle flames barely outlining her face as she asks, "You're feeling it, too?" <ul> <li>[[″Feeling what, exactly? What is this?″->Ch11_Ariana-a]]</li> <li>[[″Yes, and I don't like it. What is going on?″->Ch11_Ariana-b]]</li> <li>[[″Is it something you're causing?″->Ch11_Ariana-c]]</li> </ul>You retreat to your quarters for a few hours. <center><<button [[Next|Ch11_Night]]>><</button>></center>You find $wilfred near the armory, looking at a patch of grass reddened by the other day's attempt on your life. $w_He watches your approach, back pressed against a stone wall, arms crossed not far below $w_his sullen expression. "$mcname_will," $w_he says, kicking $w_himself away from the wall, "tomorrow will be your first real-scale battle, won't it?" <ul> <li>[[″Yes.″->Ch11_Willa]]</li> <li>[[″Stating the obvious, I see. What is going on?" <<include Ch11_Ariana2>>"Is it something you're causing?" "In a way." She chuckles, but there is no mirth behind it. <<include Ch11_Ariana2>>"It's Aether," she explains, pulling herself away from the table. As she moves closer to you by degrees, the high-pitched screech grows incrementally in your ears. It's even worse than earlier. Like a thousand tiny ants scurrying around, right on the underside of your skin. You can't help stepping away, hand pressed to the side of your skull. It does little to abate your unease; only putting physical distance between you and your sister does. Ariana stops trying to reach you, and you feel more than see her gaze on you. "I might have gathered a little too much of it," she says, crossing her hands behind her back. She steps further away to rest against the wall by the closed window. "I can't take the risk of losing, tomorrow. <i>We</i> can't take that risk. The Kingdom's future hangs in the balance." "Isn't it dangerous?" you ask, "what you've done?" "I don't know." She looks away. "I don't care. Letting Stanislas slip between our fingers is not an option. Tomorrow, we will capture—or kill him, and we will retake the castle." She gives a dismissive shrug, and bats a stray umber hair away from her face. "Anyway. Too much Aether shouldn't do any long lasting damage. Once Stanislas is out of the picture, I'll be able to afford some rest." <ul> <li>[[″Still. "Be careful out there," $c_he requests, letting you go. "I would be very cross if anything were to happen to you." $c_He casts a final smile your way, and leaves the tent. <<include Ch11_WhereTo>>You feel the urge to say <i>something</i>… You're headed to a battlefield. Maybe you won't be getting another chance, whispers a part of you. <ul> <li>[[″I love you,″ I blurt out.->Ch11_CyrilLoveConfession]]</li> <li>[[″I love you,″ I say with certainty.->Ch11_CyrilLoveConfession]]</li> <li>[[On second thought, I would rather not say anything.->Ch11_CyrilSkipConfess]]</li> </ul><<set $serious_cyril = true>><<set $emotional to $emotional.fm(+5)>><<set $aff_cyril to $aff_cyril.fm(+5)>><<set $mcconfessed_cyril = true>>"I love you." $c_He freezes. After you've uttered those three words, so small yet so heavy with meaning, $c_he stops even breathing, and only $c_his eyes move, blinking at you, wider now. A moment of silence passes. Your heartbeat spikes in your chest, very loud in your ears as Cyril remains quiet, gaze riveted to yours. $c_He breaths in, eventually, licks $c_his lips, and when $c_his smile returns, it does so with a vengeance, brighter still than before. "$mcname," $c_he says, "are you not aware that this is an exceedingly dangerous confession to make before a battle?" $c_His tone is light as $c_he continues, "Such declarations often end in tragedy. Are you trying to get me killed?" <ul> <li>[[″What? "Wait! $mcname!" $c_he calls back, but you don't stop, zigzagging between the soldiers until you're safely back inside the fort. <<include Ch11_WhereTo>>$c_He chuckles, tilts $c_his head a little, and watches you while a warm smile spreads across $c_his face. "I'm only joking," $c_he says, voice low. $c_He stares at you, and, swimming in the black pool of $c_his pupils, there is the beginning of a reply to your confession. "Soldiers!" While your army watches her from both sides of the fort's gates, Ariana climbs the steps to the ramparts overlooking the men and women who will be risking their lives for your kingdom tonight. "My brothers and sisters, sons and daughters of Arcadie," she says once she has reached the top, voice ringing in the silence she has commanded. "The day you've been waiting for has finally come. The day we would reclaim our castle and root out lawless snakes from our glorious lands." The metallic rivets in her leather armor shine in the moonlight, and there is a determined glimmer in her eye as she declares, louder still, "Tonight, we face Stanislas and his company of traitors and murderers. Tonight, we spill their blood—the dark blood of liars and cowards whose word means naught, and whose honor has long since been forfeit. "They cannot hope to stand to us, to stand to you. They're hiding, trembling behind the castle walls. They do not have your loyalty, they do not have your courage, and they certainly do not have your strength. "Tonight, you will show them what it means to be a true soldier of Arcadie. "Brothers and sisters, tonight—" She pulls out her sword, brandishing it high above her head, and its metal glows bright orange with the power of Aether. "We <i>will</i> be victorious!" Her risen sword is a beacon of light in the dark, and the soldiers around you cheer loudly, in a cacophony of swords and shields, the ground trembling with their eagerness for the upcoming battle. <ul> <li>[[I am just as eager.->Ch11_End][$pacifist to $pacifist.fm(-5)]]</li> <li>[[I am terrified.->Ch11_End][$timid to $timid.fm(+5)]]</li> <li>[[I will do what must be done.->Ch11_End][$involved to $involved.fm(+5)]]</li> <li>[[I would have hoped for a peaceful resolution, but so be it.->Ch11_End][$pacifist to $pacifist.fm(+5)]]</li> <li>[[I wish I could have found a way to get out of this.->Ch11_End][$involved to $involved.fm(-5)]]</li> </ul>You move out just as the moon disappears behind a thick gray blanket of clouds. <center><<button [[To The Castle...|Ch12_01]]>><</button>></center><<set $gamestarted = false, $met_will = false, $met_stan = false, $met_cyril = false, $met_nath = false>><<if Save.autosave.ok() && Save.autosave.has()>><center><<button "Resume">><<script>>Save.autosave.load()<</script>><</button>></center> <</if>><center><<button [[Start game|ROGender]]>><</button>></center> <center><<button "Load game">><<script>>UI.saves()<</script>><</button>></center> <center><<button "Settings">><<script>>UI.settings()<</script>><</button>></center> <center><<button [[How to Play|Tips]]>><</button>></center> <center><<button [[Credits|Credits]]>><</button>></center> <center><<button "Exit">><<script>>window.close()<</script>><</button>></center><<if $response == 1>><<set $response = 0>>Reluctantly, you step away from your hideout place, and sprint out after your sister.<<else>>"I was going to." You step away from your hiding place, sprinting out after your sister.<</if>> You run, fast and close to the ground, darting across the empty expanse towards the castle walls. As you look up, towards the ramparts, you can see lights and hear the noises of battle coming from the other side of the castle, but thankfully, none seems the wiser to your current approach. The wall is within reach, only a few feet away. <center><<button [[TWACK!|Ch12_04]]>><</button>></center><<set $leader += 1>>"Aim for the ramparts!" you order quickly, pointing upwards; time is of the essence as you're currently out of cover, at the mercy of the archers high above who have the advantage of the higher ground. Your soldiers equip their bows, aiming up and sending arrows towards the ramparts, enough of a distraction to prevent your enemy from taking you out. A high-pitched buzz suddenly crawls up the base of your skull, and you wince. You pivot around. Ariana is glowing, a beacon of the destruction she is aiming to unleash on the castle wall. She gives you no time to prepare before she dashes forward, connecting with the wall in a blinding ball of energy. The ground shakes under your feet, and you sway, fighting to keep your balance. Light explodes in front of you. Almost an earthquake, stone fragments flying out all around and above you. You huddle down on instinct, protecting your head from any debris that might strike it. <center><<button [[Next|Ch12_05]]>><</button>></center><<set $emotional to $emotional.fm(10), $leader -= 2, $army_support -= 2>>You turn towards the soldiers waiting for your instructions. What are you supposed to do? What are you supposed to say? They stare at you, and you open your mouth, but no sound comes out. A blood-curdling scream coming from the castle fills your mind with dread, and you hunker onto yourself. Swords clashing, pain, death, tears, you can't— You can't. A high-pitched buzz suddenly crawls up the base of your skull, making you wince. You pivot around. Ariana is glowing, a beacon of the destruction she is aiming to unleash on the castle wall. She gives you no time to prepare before she dashes forward, connecting with the wall in a blinding ball of energy. The ground shakes under your feet, and you sway, fighting to keep your balance. Light explodes in front of you. Almost an earthquake, stone fragments flying out all around and above you. You huddle down on instinct, protecting your head from any debris that might strike it. <center><<button [[Next|Ch12_05]]>><</button>></center><<if $response == 1>>"What?!" you quickly ask. You notice too late the knife in her free hand.<<elseif $response == 2>>"Let go of me!" you demand. She sneers, sharp canines visible below her upper lip, and doesn't abide by your request, getting closer instead. You notice too late the knife in her free hand.<<elseif $response == 3>>You try to push her away, but she only clamps down harder on your forearm. You notice too late the knife in her free hand.<<else>>You don't move, but when she holds a knife up to you, you start thinking that remaining silent might have been a mistake.<</if>> She quickly slashes at your palm with her knife, and before you can react, she clasps her hand into yours. <<include Ch12_07bis>>Your soldiers meet Stanislas's in a crash of swords and screams. To your left, the gate cracks open with a loud bang; Cyril's forces have now joined the fray, and they ram into makeshift fortifications in a clatter of wood and metal. Ariana joins you, and you notice her slack expression, lost in distant thoughts rather than the present moment. <<if $aff_ariana < 40>>Her green eyes snap to you, and suddenly she's grabbing your arm in a vice-like grip, screaming above the clamor of battle, "I need it back!" <ul> <li>[[″What?!″ I quickly ask.->Ch12_07negative][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″Let go of me!″->Ch12_07negative][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[I shake her off.->Ch12_07negative][$response = 3]]</li> <li>[[I stare at her, waiting for her to clarify.->Ch12_07negative][$response = 4]]</li> </ul><<else>>Her green eyes snap to you, and suddenly she's holding you by the arm, screaming above the clamor of battle, "$mcname! It ends as quickly as it had started, pain subsiding the instant Ariana lets go of you, triumph in her lopsided smile. She unsheathes her longsword again, and faces back towards the ongoing battle. You both watch as more of your soldiers pour into the castle, clashing with force with the enemy. "Let's get Stanislas!" she exclaims, casting you a glance above her shoulder before launching herself forth. <center><<button [[Next|Ch12_07choice]]>><</button>></center>While your soldiers manage to deal with most of the opposition in your path, Ariana and you must defend yourselves, as well. Several hours pass—or is it only a few minutes? It's all a blur of blood, sweat and adrenaline, pushing and slicing through the enemy. Your sword arm is beginning to hurt, the shock of metal on metal shaking your shoulder as you continuously parry and slash. Your ears are abuzz with screams and blood-curdling cries, the sounds of war quickening your heart, turning your stomach and tightening your grip around your sword. <ul> <li>[[I absolutely hate it.->Ch12_09][$emotional to $emotional.fm(5), $sword to $sword.fm(5)]]</li> <li>[[I strangely enjoy it.->Ch12_09][$diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(-5), $sword to $sword.fm(5), $pacifist to $pacifist.fm(-5)]]</li> <li>[[It has to be done, and that's all there is to it.->Ch12_09][$sword to $sword.fm(5), $involved to $involved.fm(5)]]</li> <li>[[I find myself often freezing in fear, and am saved more than once by one of our men.->Ch12_09][$leader -= 1, $army_support -= 1]]</li> </ul>Your small group clashes again with his soldiers; men and women, steadfast and fierce, every one of them. There is something <i>different</i> in the way they fight. Devoid of fear, full of staunch, righteous determination. It is unnerving, how they seem to see you as an obstacle in their path, while just a month ago, these very same men and women were sworn to defend you with their lives. Now it is your very life they strive to take. You hear Stanislas shout something over the clamor; you can't make much sense of it as you're facing off against a rather young recruit, her helmet a little too big over her head, almost hiding her big eyes as she grits her teeth at you. You've seldom been watched with as much hate and vitriol as is held in her gaze, and you're certain that, in this moment, your death would bring her all the happiness in the world. <<if $sword >= 50>>She rushes you, her moves quickened by her small size; and you counter every strike and attempted cut with ease, her speed not nearly enough to overcome all your years of training.<<else>>She rushes you, her moves quickened by her small size; and while you're at first surprised by her agility, you quickly adjust and counter her strikes with your own. She is not a skilled fighter. But what she lacks in talent, she makes up with tenacity.<</if>> As she makes an attempt to hit up at your neck, you deflect to the right, leaving her open to a subsequent, fatal attack. In the split second that follows, her eyes are round, and she knows she is about to die. <ul> <li>[[I strike her down, killing her.->Ch12_10][$response = 1, $ch12_killed_lilia = true, $pacifist to $pacifist.fm(-10)]]</li> <li>[[I disarm her and incapacitate her, with a cut to her right arm.->Ch12_10][$response = 2, $ch12_injured_lilia = true, $pacifist to $pacifist.fm(5)]]</li> <li>[[I disarm her and leave her uninjured.->Ch12_10][$response = 3, $pacifist to $pacifist.fm(10)]]</li> </ul>Inside the castle, it is entirely dark, except for the flickering torches on the walls. The entrance hall is large, a magnificent hallway that used to sparkle when beams of sunlight warmed the golden rimmed windows, now reduced to a somber, empty, and lifeless shadow of itself. There are stairs on either of its sides leading up to the meeting room, but that is of no immediate concern, as that is not where either Stanislas or Ariana is headed; Stanislas has rushed ahead, into the throne room located on the ground level, and your sister is right on his tail, footsteps ringing loudly in the empty wing while the battle rages on outside. You go after them. <center><<button [[Next|Ch12_11]]>><</button>></center>"Ariana! Is there really need for more bloodshed? You could ask for his surrender!" She scoffs so loud it reverberates on the walls. <<if $aff_ariana >= 40>>"Fine," she says, surprisingly. Sword raised in his direction, she demands, "You heard $him. Surrender, Stanislas, and I <i>might</i> allow you to keep some of your fingers. Perhaps even a bit of your tongue." His eyes flicker between you, lingering a moment on you. "A tempting offer, I'm sure," he says eventually, "but I'm afraid I'll have to turn it down." "Good," your sister replies.<<else>>"Shut up!" Her free hand almost seems to shoo you away. "Go cower in the corner if fighting frightens you this much!"<</if>> <center><<button [[Next|Ch12_12]]>><</button>></center>"Stanislas! Are you so keen on throwing the Kingdom into chaos?" He slides a skeptical side glance your way. "<i>Your</i> family is perpetually throwing Arcadie into war and unrest," he retorts, "no matter the cost to your subjects." "You murdered our parents at a peace meeting. You're hardly a figure of peace yourself!" He seems amused, somehow. "Had my original plan been successful, it would have allowed for the removal of the whole of your family from the throne, with little to no collateral victims. Unfortunately, I underestimated $wilfred's blind loyalty to your line, hence your survival." He readjusts his shield—your family's shield, eyes now locked on Ariana. "I'd like to see you try!" <center><<button [[Next|Ch12_12]]>><</button>></center><<if ndef $textGroup>><<set $textGroup = 1>><</if>><<switch $textGroup>> <<case 1>>You turn back, heading quickly towards the exit, and try your hand at opening the massive wooden doors. You grab the handles, pulling firmly on them. But they don't budge. You try again, to no avail. The doors seem to be blocked from the other side. You swivel back when you hear a loud crash behind you. <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<case 2>>Stanislas is face to the ground, and your sister moves quickly before he has a chance to recover, aiming down her sword at the middle of his back. Not quick enough; he rolls away, standing up fast, but he's lost his sword in the process, the blade lying abandoned a few feet away. He still has your family shield, however. "I've changed my mind," Ariana declares, and your eardrums suddenly vibrate painfully. "I'll grant you a quick death after all, Stanislas!" You have to resist the urge to press your hands over your ears, to protect them from the deep buzz filling the room with hot anger as Ariana's sword shines red, infusing the hall with scorching heat and blinding light. When she lunges forward towards Stanislas, and aims at him in a finishing strike, he holds his ground, round shield held up to block her attack, but you know, from having witnessed Ariana in action before, that her Aether-fueled strike cannot be parried. It will cut through the shield, and through him, in one swift move. <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<default>>When the sword connects with the shield, there is an ear-splitting clash, a burst of light that makes you press your eyes shut. And when you open them again in a squint, Ariana has been hurled several feet backwards. Stanislas is still standing, unscathed, whole body taut from bracing himself against the impact, and the shield is intact in his grasp, glowing faintly red. Ariana quickly recovers, undaunted and unharmed, too, but astonished still that her Aether-charged attack has not ended the fight. "How?" she asks. "You—" Voice raising, she grips her sword tight, teeth gritted as she looms closer. "You can't!" she maintains. "You <i>cannot</i> wield our shield! You <i>cannot</i> use Aether!" Stanislas deigns not to answer, using her momentary befuddlement to sprint aside, retrieving his sword from the ground and directing an upward slash at her. What follows is an exchange of blows, loud clashes of metal. While Stanislas's moves are just as swift and precise as before, Ariana seems slower, perhaps having drained what reserve of Aether she had left. <<unset $textGroup>><ul> <li>[[She needs my help. A sharp wave of her arm, directed not at his weapon but at his feet, and Stanislas loses his balance, crashing face first to the ground. She wastes no time in trying to skewer him, but he rolls away, standing up quickly, shield still in hand but sword lost on the floor, blade lying abandoned a few feet away. Stanislas turns to watch you, gaze dark and steady, sword hanging low next to Ariana's body, her blood dripping down his blade and his own drawing sharp red lines down the side of his jaw. You're alone, surrounded by enemies. <ul> <li>[[Stanislas will die, if it's the last thing I do.->Ch12_19][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[I am going to die, too–I'm outnumbered and alone.->Ch12_19][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[Maybe I can try to parley, try to get out of this with my life.->Ch12_19][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[I could try running away.->Ch12_19][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[I don't know what to do.->Ch12_19][$response = 2]]</li> </ul>You dash behind her, trying to avoid tripping over the gravel littering what was once a beautiful garden, now a scene of combat and dread. Swords strike, men scream, arrows plunge into what exposed flesh they can find. One misses you by a hair, a loud whiz by your ears as you push yourself to keep up with Ariana's brisk pace. "Soldiers!" she yells, longsword brandished over her head. "With me!" A rallying cry meant for your own men, but that you can't help but fear might only attract the enemy's attention. As it turns out, your instincts aren't wrong, and an arrow narrowly misses her, making her shift to her right, glancing up at the ramparts where most of the enemy archers are still looking down at you. A roar makes you face left, and you spot a fully armored knight running right at her, his sword in hand ready to strike her down. Ariana does not seem to have noticed, however, and with her back turned to you, you can't make anything of her awareness of the danger. <ul> <li>[['"Ariana! Watch out!"'->Ch12_08][$response = 1, $aff_ariana to $aff_ariana.fm(5)]]</li> <li>[[I sprint out to defend her.->Ch12_08][$response = 2, $aff_ariana to $aff_ariana.fm(5)]]</li> <li>[[I remain where I am. I can't help.->Ch12_08][$response = 3, $timid to $timid.fm(-5)]]</li> <li>[[I remain where I am. I don't want to help.->Ch12_08][$response = 3, $friendly to $friendly.fm(-10)]]</li> </ul>You startle awake. Early morning, shades of green and brown all around you, the scent of grass in the air, the song of birds in the trees. You're in a forest, on horseback, and someone is holding you up, one arm around your waist. <ul> <li>[[I send my elbow backwards, right into their face.->Ch13_Elbow]]</li> <li>[[I turn around and take a look at who they are.->Ch13_Turn]]</li> <li>[[I scream.->Ch13_Scream]]</li> <li>[[I don't move.->Ch13_DontMove]]</li> </ul><<set $timid to $timid.fm(-5)>>You send your elbow back, hard and quick; it jars you when it connects with an open hand which grips you tight, preventing you from pulling away. "$mcname," a familiar voice says right behind you, and your nerves momentarily settle down. It is… <ul> <<if $aff_cyril >= 60>><li>[[Cyril.->Ch13_Elbow_C]]</li><<else>><span style="color:grey; pointer-events: none"><li>Cyril.</li></span><</if>> <li>[[$wilfred + "."->Ch13_Elbow_W]]</li> </ul>You swivel around, as much as you can while on horseback, to take a look at the person behind you. You know you should not let them. You quickly stride to the side, rushing to the soldier the furthest to the left. You have one less opponent to worry about, one of them scattering weapon in hand toward Cyril, while the other two jump at you. It's not the easiest task, fighting two soldiers at once; even in your normal state, it would be far from simple, but now, exhausted as you are, legs still shaky and every limb cottony, it is definitely a challenge. It births sparks in the back of your vision, and when your remove your hands, you need a moment to see again. Cyril is still right there, standing by your bed and watching you, a hint of melancholy to $c_his gaze. <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<default>>You sit up slowly, and spin around to put a foot down on the wooden ground. The other foot follows, and you push yourself off the bed. You draw a breath, standing tall. But then your sight fills with stars, and you're not sure which side is up anymore. An arm quickly snaps to take hold of you, steadying you and putting an end to your swaying. Your head continues spinning, but you're aware that you're still standing upright, thanks to Cyril's quick reflexes. "I've got you," $c_he says. "Let's get you seated at the table, alright?" $c_He lets you find your footing, walks you toward a wooden table, and helps you sit down. When you're done shaking the last remnants of your dizzy spell, you recognize in front of you what you surmise passes for breakfast in these parts of your kingdom. Bread, ham, some fruit, haphazardly placed on a polished wooden tray. It is clear you're in no castle, no fort, no nothing. Cyril sits down next to you, still with the same despondent honey gaze. "It's not much, but you have to eat something. You haven't eaten anything in two days." <<unset $textGroup>><ul> <li>[[I begrudgingly eat a little.->Ch15_Cyril_Eat]]</li> <li>[[″I'm not hungry.″->Ch15_Cyril_NotEat]]</li> </ul><</switch>><<if def $textGroup>><<set $textGroup += 1>><</if>><<if ndef $textGroup>><<set $textGroup = 1>><</if>><<switch $textGroup>> <<case 1>>You wake up when fabric rustles nearby; fingers over your covers reaching for your shoulder, grasping it gingerly and giving it a small squeeze. Soon, your sight is inundated with light, curtains suddenly drawn to let the sunlight spill into the small room. You shuffle closer to the window and watch as gray and white towers emerge above the horizon, standing heavily around the tall ramparts that encircle your capital, Goldridge, at the edge of the Caspienne sea, and its long sea-washed walls and sun-kissed roofs. An impregnable fortress, or so the legend says; as it's been raided time and time again, never to fall to the invader. Goldridge might be the jewel of your Kingdom, but you're not overly familiar with the city. Your mother disliked it, you remember; for what reason, you can't exactly say, but she seemed to prefer being away in the Royal Castle, far from the bustle and noise of the capital. He theatrically drops his head back, his book coming up to press against his forehead. "You let Ariana die, didn't you?" He snaps up, letting the book hit the floor as he leaves his chair, eyes wide and a short, shrill, humorless laugh falling from his lips. You do. "Breathe out. That's it. Just focus on that." There is no noise in Nathaniel's study, expect for the distant cry of seagulls that can be heard through the closed windows, and the steady roll of waves and their crashing against the city walls. You hear shuffling close-by. "Good. Now. Don't open your eyes. Tell me what you feel." You keep breathing slowly, deeply, and you perceive, a little too close for comfort, some sort of source of heat. Your right temple tingles unpleasantly, like under the feet of a dozen scurrying ants. "I feel a tingle. Warmth." "Good. Now, don't overthink it. Just focus on the tingling sensation. It's not harmful, even if it's uncomfortable. Focus on that, and on its warmth." You start hearing your own heartbeat in your ear, and you feel dizziness creeping in, a vague sense of nausea swirling in your stomach as you force yourself to focus, harder, on the feeling. "The warmth is yours for the taking," he says slowly, "so take it." You're not sure what he means, but you try to do as he asks. Take the warmth. Focus. You breathe in, pull it in closer. It spreads over your face, unpleasantly hot; the tingling migrates to your whole skull, focusing at its base, at your nape, and your fingers curl over your clothes as goosebumps sprout over your arms; warmth, slick, thick, verging on burning, spreads inside you. Your breathing grows quicker, and you grit your teeth, fighting back the feeling of oppression on your whole head. "So… You <i>do</i> have the Gift." You open your eyes, blinking as you find an empty globe of glass right to your nose. Nathaniel withdraws the orb to spin it between his long fingers. <ul> <li>[[″What did you do?″->Ch15_Will_Nath16][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″What happened?″->Ch15_Will_Nath16][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[″How can you tell?″->Ch15_Will_Nath16][$response = 3]]</li> </ul><<set $aether_charge += 5>>He puts the orb down on the nearby desk, an impish smile at his lips. "Any member of your family can use Aether—or could, I suppose." He handwaves his slip. "But only someone with the Gift can actively gather Aether." He points to the orb. "This was an Aether lamp. You drained all of its Aether out." "Oh." Your vision blurs. You try blinking it away, but can't. "Anything that makes you feel that tingling sensation, that warmth, can be a source of Aether. Ariana used to say that really strong sources gave a metallic taste right at the tip of her tongue. She said that forests, seasides, and lakes were great for gathering Aether. Fire, too. You should give it a try." It pulsates at the base of your skull, and spreads very quickly; a migraine like you've never felt before, a vice gripping your temples and squeezing them in an unrelenting grip. You press your eyes shut, hoping the absence of light will make it go away faster. <<if $aff_will >= 60 && $flirt_will > 1>> "$mcname_will?" A shuffling of feet, and a hand holds your shoulder. Bring $him back whenever $he does, I'll teach $him a few tricks." <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<default>>Calling the ride back to the castle uncomfortable is an understatement. Small mercy, you're able to pull the curtains back and enjoy some darkness, which does alleviate your headache a bit. $wilfred orders the driver to go slow, which also helps a little. <<if $aff_will >= 60 && $flirt_will > 1>> $wilfred steadies you, preventing the carriage's every shake from jostling you, and that helps, too. You quickly sink into blissful oblivion. <<if $aff_will >= 60 && $flirt_will > 1>><<unset $textGroup>><center><<button [[A Few Hours Later...|Ch15_Will_Rom]]>><</button>></center><<else>><<unset $textGroup>><center><<button [[Rest...|Ch16_01]]>><</button>></center><</if>> <</switch>><<if def $textGroup>><<set $textGroup += 1>><</if>>You can't get up. Your headache is anchoring you to your bed, forcing you into darkness, away from noise, lights, sound, people. A servant came by a few hours ago to leave a tray of food on a table in the next room, and the smell wafting from it, while surely appetizing to well-constituted individuals, has been doing nothing but making your insides churn. But you can't get up, can't reach the door to get rid of the foul aroma and of its source. It hurts to breathe, it hurts to think, it hurts to be alive. The door creaks open and you instantly curse its existence. Footsteps. Perhaps the servant back to take the food away. Hopefully. Instead, the steps inch closer to you, dampened by the carpet. Nothing happens for a while. Then a voice, low, barely perceptible, not loud enough to send a sharp peak of pain in your head. "$mcname_will. Are you awake?" $wilfred. <ul> <li>[[″…I am.″->Ch15_Will_Rom01][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[I hum in answer.->Ch15_Will_Rom01][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[["I don't respond and pretend to be asleep. I want " + $w_him + " to leave."->Ch15_Will_Rom_End]]</li> </ul><<nobr>><<set $ch16_start = true>><<if $mcname_cyril == "Your Highness">> <<set $mcname_cyril = "Your Majesty">><</if>> <<if $mcname_will == "Your Highness">> <<set $mcname_will "Your Majesty">><</if>> <<if $aff_will >= 60>> <<set $approval_will to $approval_will.fm(20)>><</if>> <<if $aff_will >= 60 && $inlove_will == true>> <<set $approval_will to $approval_will.fm(+30)>><</if>> <<if $aff_will < 40>> <<set $approval_will to $approval_will.fm(-30)>><</if>> <<if $aff_cyril < 40>> <<set $approval_cyril to $approval_cyril.fm(-30)>><</if>> <</nobr>>A couple of days fly by. You feel better, incrementally; you start eating more, spending more time out of your room, and can now actually stand being in the sunlight without a migraine overtaking you. You are supposed to meet with your commanders this morning—Cyril sent you a message stating $c_his need to consult you on important matters. <ul> <li>[[Which feels strange, but I am slowly coming to terms with my new role, and what it entails.->Ch16_02][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[I feel out of place, like an impostor.->Ch16_02][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[["I haven't fully processed that I am now the " + $King + "."->Ch16_02][$response = 3]]</li> <li>[[While I am afraid of failing in my duty, I will uphold it.->Ch16_02][$response = 4]]</li> <li>[[I'm glad to finally have power in the cusp of my hand.->Ch16_02][$response = 5]]</li> <li>[[I will do what must be done. My feelings on the matter are of no concern.->Ch16_02][$response = 6]]</li> <li>[[Nothing about this agrees with me, but I can't see an immediate way out of it.->Ch16_02][$response = 7]]</li> </ul><<if $response == 1>>"…I am," you manage to reply. "I've been informed that you haven't been eating."<<elseif $response == 2>>You hum a short sound. It is enough of an answer for $wilfred, as $w_he next declares, "I've been informed that you haven't been eating."<</if>> <ul> <li>[[″I wouldn't be able to keep it down.″->Ch15_Will_Rom02][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″It smells awful.″->Ch15_Will_Rom02][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[″Someone is actually keeping you updated on whether I've eaten or not?″->Ch15_Will_Rom02][$response = 3]]</li> </ul><<set $inlove_will = false, $interest_will = false>>You don't stir, focus on keeping your breathing steady and your eyes inconspicuously closed. Silence, then a shuffling of feet, striding away from you. The door closes softly behind $wilfred as $w_he departs. <center><<button [[Rest...|Ch16_01]]>><</button>></center><<if $response == 1>>"I wouldn't be able to keep it down." <<elseif $response == 2>>"Just its smell makes me feel sick," you mutter, voice unsteady from disuse. <<elseif $response == 3>>"Someone is actually keeping you updated on whether I've eaten or not?" "No. I asked your attendants." A beat. <</if>><<set $NoPain = false>>"Do you feel any pain?" $w_he inquires, concern making $w_his tone a little subdued. <ul> <li>[[″A little bit,″ I minimize.->Ch15_Will_Rom03][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″My head hurts.″->Ch15_Will_Rom03][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[″Everything is pain.″->Ch15_Will_Rom03][$response = 3]]</li> <li>[["[Lie] ″No.″"->Ch15_Will_Rom03][$response = 4]]</li> </ul><<if $response == 1>>"I do. A little bit." Not really the truth. There is nothing little about the spikes of hurt lancing you. <<elseif $response == 2>>"My head hurts," you say. <<elseif $response == 3>><<set $playful %+5>> "Everything is pain," you say, half-serious. <<else>><<set $NoPain = true>> "No," you say, ignoring the pulse of hurt running inside your head from ear to ear. <</if>>Silence, then footsteps, moving away this time, and the door to your quarters softly closing. You're left alone for a few minutes, and when the door opens again, you recognize $wilfred by the sound of $w_his steps—steady and purposeful. "Take this," $w_he says nearby. "Swallow it whole." You turn around, shifting under the covers, and your eyes, used to the darkness, land on the form of $wilfred, kneeling down by your bedside. $w_His hand is upturned towards you, and in the middle of $w_his palm lie two oblong tablets. Probably some sort of medicine.<<set $TakenMeds = false>> "What's that?" you ask, trying hard not to slur your words. "Tanacetum tablets. <<if $NoPain == true>> They'll help you feel better." <<else>> They'll ease your pain."<</if>> "Tanacetum?" you repeat groggily. $w_He pauses a moment. "Some type of flower. The apothecary makes them. They're smooth, brown and a little cold, and encased in sugar, you realize as you pop one into your mouth. "Don't chew." A hand slides under your shoulders, and you're slowly eased into a sitting position, $wilfred holding you while $w_he offers you a glass of water. Your head spins, and you grimace as a spike of pain pierces through your temple. "I'm sorry, $mcname_will. This will make you feel better." <ul> <li>[["I let " + $w_him + " help me drink."->Ch15_Will_Rom_04][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[I take the glass and drink.->Ch15_Will_Rom_04][$response = 2]]</li> </ul>You refuse to take the tablets. $wilfred stands back up. $w_He gives a nod, twisting away. "Can you keep me company a little while?" $w_His body finishes pivoting completely, facing you squarely. <<if ($diplomatic >= 60 || $playful >= 60 || $friendly >= 60) && $timid <= 50>> "Being bedridden is quite boring," you add, reaching deep into your limited energy pool to pull a smile.<<else>> "Only if you want to," you add.<</if>> "Of course," comes $w_his immediate reply. $w_He drops a quick look around, and grabs the nearest chair to plop it down next to your bed. There is a transient tightening of $w_his features, lips thinning an instant as $w_his arms fold over $w_his chest. "There isn't much to know," $w_he says, not meeting your eye. "They're dead. They have been for a long time." "I'm sorry." A light shake of $w_his head. <ul> <li>[[″Still… Can you tell me more about them?″->Ch15_Will_Fam01][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″Do you want to talk about them?″->Ch15_Will_Fam01][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[I drop the subject.->Ch15_Will_Rom_EndQuestionsWill]]</li> </ul><<set $ch15_will_family = true>><<if $response == 1>>"Still… Can you tell me more about them?" you ask. <<elseif $response == 2>>"Do you want to talk about them?" you ask. <</if>>$w_His eyes fix themselves upon you, and you can read surprise, a little reluctance in the crease between $w_his brows. "My father was the Lord of Einberg," $w_he says, $w_his tone slow, as if careful in $w_his choice of words. "He was strict, but fair. My mother had been a soldier before they married, and remained in charge of the garrison. She taught me to fight—as much as you can teach an eight-year old, anyway." $w_His smile fades as quickly as it appears, and $w_he shifts in $w_his seat, looking away, a wistful glimmer in $w_his eye. "Luca was the youngest, never to stay still for long. And Adele was the oldest. A fact she never failed to bring up when I refused to listen to her. She was barely fourteen when…" $w_He doesn't need to continue for you to grasp the meaning behind $w_his pause. "…when Kalltland razed Einberg to the ground," $w_he suddenly resumes. "Murdered every man, woman and child in their path." When you think that $w_he'll be receding back into silence, $w_he adds, "Your mother saved my life." $w_He looks your way, meeting your gaze steadily. "And I swore that day that I would serve the Royal family till my last breath." $w_His voice is tight with self-directed anger as $w_he stares down at $w_his crossed arms. "I have done a pitiful job of it lately. For that, I apologize." <ul> <<if $ch14_will_accused == true>><li>[[″I'm the one who should be apologizing for what I said, back in Giron.″->Ch15_Will_Fam02][$response = 1]]</li><</if>> <li>[[″On the contrary. He then looks at you invitingly, a hand showing you the empty seat in front of him. <ul> <<if not hasVisited ("Ch15_Cyril_Sit")>><li>[["I look at Cyril to gauge " + $c_his + " reaction."->Ch15_Cyril_Sit]]</li><</if>> <li>[[I sit in front of him.->Ch15_Cyril_Sitting]]</li> <<if not hasVisited ("Ch15_Cyril_NotSit")>><li>[[I don't want to sit.->Ch15_Cyril_NotSit]]</li><</if>> </ul><</if>>You face Cyril, sitting at the edge of the sofa, but $c_he remains mostly impassive, giving you a smile and a nod as encouragement to sit. <ul> <li>[[I sit in front of him.->Ch15_Cyril_Sitting]]</li> <<if not hasVisited ("Ch15_Cyril_NotSit")>><li>[[I don't want to sit.->Ch15_Cyril_NotSit]]</li><</if>> </ul><<if $sit == false>>You take a short breath, walking decisively towards the open seat and lowering yourself onto it. <</if>>Cyril crosses $c_his legs at the ankles, watching attentively as Nathaniel sits in his own chair, inching forward, closer to you. "Being near her became painful, perhaps because of how much Aether she had gathered." "She shared Aether with you through her blood?" Nathaniel inquires. You confirm. "What happened next?" "We launched an attack to retake the Royal Castle.<<if $ch12_fought_stan == true>> We faced Stanislas."<<else>> Ariana faced Stanislas."<</if>> You stop. You remember. "Concentrate on something simple, your breathing for example." You do. "Breathe in, slowly. Breathe out. That's it. Just focus on that." There is no noise in Nathaniel's home, expect for the crackling of the fireplace, the distant cry of seagulls that can be heard through the closed windows, and the steady roll of waves and their crashing against the city walls. "Good. Now—" Shuffling nearby. "—Don't open your eyes. Describe what you feel." You keep breathing slowly, deeply, and you perceive, a little too close for comfort, a source of heat you can't quite identify. Your right temple tingles unpleasantly, like under the feet of a dozen scurrying ants. "I feel a tingle. Warmth." "Good. Now, don't overthink it. Just focus on that sensation. It's not harmful, even if it's uncomfortable. Focus on it, and on its warmth." You start hearing your own heartbeat in your ear, and you feel dizziness creeping in, a vague sense of nausea swirling in your stomach as you force yourself to focus, harder, on the feeling. "The warmth is yours for the taking," he says slowly, "so take it." You're not sure what he means, but you try to do as he asks. Focusing. Taking the warmth. You breathe in, willing yourself to pull it in, closer. And it spreads over your face, unpleasantly hot, the tingling migrating to your whole skull, focusing at its base, at your nape; and your fingers curl over your clothes as goosebumps sprout over your arms; warmth, slick, thick, verging on burning, spreads inside you. Your breathing grows quicker, and you grit your teeth, fighting back the feeling of oppression on your whole head. "Well. It seems you <i>do</i> have the Gift." <<unset $textGroup>><center><<button [[Next|Ch15_Cyril_Nath12]]>><</button>></center><</switch>><<if def $textGroup>><<set $textGroup += 1>><</if>><<set $aether_charge += 5>>You open your eyes, blinking as you find an empty globe of glass right to your nose. You're almost delirious, you can tell; shapes coalesce into nonsense, a ringing noise fills your ears with pain that, somehow, your brain decides to interpret as high-pitched screaming. You would give, do anything to make it stop, just for one single second. Suddenly, bliss—silence, and a cold <i>something</i> over your forehead. You breathe easily, <i>finally</i>, for the first time since what you feel must be an eternity. Groggily, you blink several times; now you're certain you're in your bedroom. Shapes finally make sense, even in the gloom—the curtains have been drawn, but afternoon light still filters through in soft, muted rays. Fabric shuffles to your right, and you turn your head on instinct— A mistake. That simple motion sends a sharp stab of pain piercing through your skull, and you can't help but hiss. "$mcname. Not yet, anyway. <</if>>Your attendant helps you dress for the day in the middle of your vast quarters. The walls, although white, are rarely bare, gleaming draperies cascading along their length in blue and gold lines. Portraits of your family adorn the spaces between the large windows; one with your parents, another with both you and Ariana, and the last one with the four of you in what must be a display of the powerful family at the helm of Arcadie. There is otherwise enough space for a large, elegant desk, and several bookcases; a piano, a round table with four chairs, and of course a large space reserved for your bed. <ul> <li>[[I have decided to leave the decor as is.->Ch16_03]]</li> <li>[[I have requested to have the portraits taken down.->Ch16_03][$ch16_portraits = false]]</li> </ul><<if $mcgender == "male">> <<set $elena = "Leon">><</if>>These are the royal quarters, your mother's old chambers. She rarely spent time here, hence the absence of any personal items; still, the color scheme is very reminiscent of what you remember of her taste. Your attendant, $elena, is a $man of few words; extreme in $his efficiency, but also excessive in $his taciturnity. $He will respond if you ask $him a question, of course, but only in the sparsest of sentences, and will otherwise be perfectly content to attend to $his duties in complete silence. As $elena awaits your decision regarding your current choice of apparel, you look back at your reflexion cast by the large mirror in front of the vast cupboards holding various garments in your size. <ul> <li>[[I chose to wear the military uniform suited to my rank as Commander-in-Chief of the armies of Arcadie.->Ch16_04][$ch16_clothes = "uniform"]]</li> <<if $mcgender == "female">><li>[[I am wearing an elegant dress.->Ch16_04][$ch16_clothes = "dress"]]</li><<else>><li>[[I am dressed in an elegant suit.->Ch16_04][$ch16_clothes = "suit"]]</li><</if>> <li>[[I opted for a casual outfit.->Ch16_04][$ch16_clothes = "casual"]]</li> </ul><<if $ch16_clothes == "uniform">> It is reminiscent of Ariana's uniform, deep blue, golden buttons and trim, with a crest—a rose, emblem of your kingdom, embroidered across your heart. The golden stripes over your epaulettes, in their distinctive slanted pattern, leave no doubt to the fact that you are the Commander-in-Chief of your armies. <</if>><<if $ch16_clothes != "dress">> After helping you fasten your belt and buttons,<<else>> After helping you into your dress,<</if>> $elena presents you with your sword; it is no longer your trusty silver-handle blade, lost in the battle against Stanislas, but a golden one, its pommel engraved with the Arcadie rose and encrusted with rubies. <ul> <li>[[I take my new sword with me.->Ch16_05][$ch16_sword = true]]</li> <li>[[I have no need for a sword inside the palace.->Ch16_05][$ch16_sword = false]]</li> </ul><<if $ch16_sword == true>> $elena buckles the sword to your side, then bows deeply as $he exits your chambers.<<else>>As you refuse your sword, $elena puts it away, then bows deeply as $he exists your chambers.<</if>> <<if $ch16_portraits == true && $ch14_grief_ariana == true>>Once alone, you find your gaze flitting back towards the portraits adorning the wall. A red carpet runs its length, softening your steps as you head for the council room, where Cyril asked you to meet. It is sunny outside, the warm rays spilling on you through the tall glass panes. You take a turn and find yourself almost at your destination, judging by the presence of both your commanders in front of a wooden double door. <<if $aff_cyril >= 40>> "Good morning, $mcname_cyril," Cyril greets you, swiveling to face you with a warm smile. <<else>> "Good morning, $mcname_cyril," Cyril greets you, a mostly straight, facsimile of a smile across $c_his face.<</if>> You pause a moment to take in $c_his new appearance: $c_he has foregone the midnight blue uniform of Arcadie commanders in favor of a new, all-black one. It has a higher collar, gilt lace weaved through it and at the edge of its sleeves, trimmed in rich gold that effortlessly blends with $c_his blond hair. Clasped to $c_his epaulettes, a black cape with a vivid inner red color cascades down $c_his back, stopping at $c_his shins, near $c_his polished black leather boots. We shouldn't be taking any chances," Cyril replies, steadily calm. <</if>>"What do you wish be done with them?" $c_he asks you, tone diligently neutral. We could probably find a use for them, as bargaining chips, for example." <<if $sit == "will">> You notice $wilfred glaring at $c_him, but Cyril pointedly pays $w_him no mind. <</if>><ul> <li>[[″Let's bring them here, we'll see then.″->Ch16_StanFam2][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″Bargaining chips. That's a good idea.″->Ch16_StanFam2][$response = 2]]</li> </ul>When evening comes, so does with it the smell of the sea breeze, like a bit of salt at the back of your palate. The tint of the dying sun falling behind the horizon splatters the sky in jets of pink, mauve and blue, while wispy orange clouds lazily slide towards the west. Cyril comes to meet you at the door of your chambers, a smile set on $c_his ever smooth face, a hand grasping the pommel of the sword at $c_his hip. "Please follow me, $mcname_cyril." <center><<button [[Next|Ch16_Later2]]>><</button>></center><<set $ThankAdvice = false>>Your steps sound sharp over the wooden floorboards, filling the hallway, but not loud enough to drown out the cries of faraway gulls. There is a suspect glimmer to his eye as he next speaks, "While we are immensely chagrined by the passing of Queen Ariana, and of your parents before her, you have to understand that the Assembly cannot simply accept you as Arcadie's new monarch. "The position might be hereditary," he continues, hands behind his back, a sidelong glance at you while he moves around the hall, the air of a professor dictating words of knowledge to his students. "But the Assembly can oppose the crowning of an unsuitable candidate. "In the case of Ariana, may her soul rest peacefully in the Aether… She may have been brash. She may have been unwise. She may have been far too young, too immature. But she was strong, experienced in the ways of war. More than that, she was a sheer force of nature, a power to be reckoned with; the mere knowledge of her existence has been keeping the Kasri at bay. "And now, sadly, tragically, she is gone." His hands flop down, theatrical, and Cyril tenses next to you. "There is not a soul left in the Arcadie line… Except for you," Pascal continues, the ghost of a rueful smile splitting his lips. "You, the second-born. You, with no accomplishment to speak of, barely any experience of the world, no known talent—yet, here you are, claiming the title of $King for yourself. "You were Serene's child of peace, not meant to ever experience hardship, locked away in a golden cage like a fragile dove. You have no knowledge of war, and no capacity at statecraft." He stops, faces you squarely, expression set, and declares, "The Noble Assembly does not recognize your claim for the throne." <center><<button [[Next|Ch16_Assembly3]]>><</button>></center><<set $SolvedByCyril = false>>A heavy silence falls over the hall. Lacombe has spoken his piece. None of the other nobles try to contradict him. Quite the opposite: they're nodding, approvingly, in his direction. Next to you, Cyril does not move, $c_his face a carefully crafted mask of <<if $aff_cyril < 60>> neutrality.<<else>> neutrality, and when, feeling your gaze on $c_him, $c_he turns your way, you still can barely make anything of $c_his thoughts.<</if>> A few steps down, $wilfred is far easier to read, fiery glare directed at the back of Lacombe's skull. $w_His stance is taut, and you suspect $w_he's very much tempted to put an end to the debate with a blow of $w_his sword. <ul> <<if $politics >= 50>><li>[[There is no need for violence. "So it pains me a little to hear you speak of myself so erroneously. "I have been taught to fight and to lead from a young age. "You have not," he counters. "If you had, we would have been made aware a long time ago. "I will not let you spout falsehoods and insults in my presence. You say I have no accomplishment, no experience, no talent; allow me to prove you wrong. It makes you blink quickly, as stakes of pain stab along your spine; you stand straighter, breathing deeply, and feel the rush of Aether pulsing through your arms, bringing feverish blood to your temples. "Lord Lacombe, you overstep your station." "As Lord of the Noble Assembly, perhaps I do, $c_sir Cyril. But as spokesman for the Assembly, I certainly do not." "You do not speak for the whole Assembly." "Let us put it to a vote, then. All who stand for $King $mcname, raise your hand." There is silence in the room, and a loud noise in your head. The beating of your heart, its staccato amplified, and raising goosebumps all over your skin. You're too hot in here. You need cold, far cooler air. "All who stand against $mcname's claim for the throne, raise your hand." Blood, cold as ice, shoots through your right arm's veins, and you wince, elbow flexing reflexively, eyes squeezed shut through the pain. The temperature drops, and the pain clears. You open your eyes. <center><<button [[Next|Ch16_Aether2]]>><</button>></center><<set $diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(-10)>> <<set $noble_support to $noble_support.fm(-10)>> <<set $SolvedByCyril = true>> "Lord Lacombe, was it?" you say. "I don't know where you're getting all that from, but the fact is, nobody asked for your opinion." Lacombe sputters in laughter. Cyril glances your way, before turning towards the Lord. <<include Ch16_CyrilSolves>><<set $diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(+10)>> <<set $noble_support to $noble_support.fm(-10)>> <<set $SolvedByCyril = true>> "There is no need for violence," you try with a gesture of appeasement. "Certainly," Lacombe retorts. "There is only need for you to step aside." Cyril glances your way, before turning towards the Lord. <<include Ch16_CyrilSolves>> <<set $noble_support to $noble_support.fm(-10)>> <<set $SolvedByCyril = true>> <<set $timid to $timid.fm(+10)>> You stand there, frozen in inaction. Cyril glances your way, before turning towards the Lord. <<include Ch16_CyrilSolves>><<if $response == 1>>"I only acquired the Gift recently." <<elseif $response == 2>>"Must you speak this way? It is unbecoming of you." "How so?" he asks, puzzlement creasing his already lined brow. "A Gifted Aether user is worth a hundred regular soldiers. Keeping one hidden away is criminal." "In any case, I only acquired the Gift recently." <</if>>He only frowns deeper. "You need not know the details, Lord Lacombe," Cyril says before Pascal can verbalize the question at the tip of his tongue. "Aether is not your domain." <<include Ch16_EndDebate>>The Lord doesn't speak further. Instead, he retreats to sit down in a free<<if $ch16_used_aether == true>> seat, working hard to ignore the chill.<<else>> seat.<</if>> "Thank you, Lord Lacombe, for your contribution to this meeting," Cyril says. <<if $ch16_used_aether == true>> $c_He seems a tad subdued, standing a little away from you, and from your display of power. <</if>>"If the Lords and Ladies will it, and $His Majesty wishes it, we will now move on to other, more important topics." It is your cue to start discussing what you intend to do about Stanislas and the southern tribes. "I wish Ariana were here," you hear yourself utter. "I miss her." You find yourself imagining how she would have acted before the Assembly. "Do you think the nobles would have listened to her?" "They might have been forced to." You look at $w_him, catching a wistful smile playing on $w_his lips. "Ariana's forte isn't—<i>wasn't</i> patience, nor diplomacy. The hall would have erupted in shouting, mainly hers, and the meeting would probably have ended in a brawl." The mental scene is funny enough that you find yourself smiling, too. "Do you miss her?" you ask. $w_He meets your eye, smile erased and replaced by mild surprise. $w_His response is to slowly nod, gaze sliding away. "For several months, I was her mentor," $w_he says. "I was to teach her everything she needed to know, to be an effective leader on the battlefield." $w_His gaze locks with yours again, colder, harsher. "I watched her make her first kill, drive her sword through the heart of a man and look on as life bled out of him. I watched her fall apart, and pick herself back up as she accepted her fate as a warrior, and her responsibility as heiress to the throne." $w_His jaw tenses, and $w_he swallows. "I miss not feeling this soul-crushing guilt," $w_he confesses. "Whatever grief I may be feeling is insignificant next to yours, of course. I'm sorry, $mcname_will, for everything you've been through." You can conjure no reply, so you nod instead. Quiet fills the space between you, heavy and cloying. The dead occupy your mind, and the weight of their absence makes drawing a breath an ordeal. Like a pound of lead pressing down on your heart. "Fortunately," $wilfred suddenly says, "you're safe. And I intend to keep it that way." $w_His gaze on you drags across your shape, analytical. "Ariana would have made a powerful queen, but you're at least as strong as she was. You're perceptive, more level-headed. It almost pulls a whimper out of you. "$mcname," $c_he says, voice broken. "Do you truly want this? Being with me." It strikes you as a rather superfluous question, but before you can voice your opinion, $c_he continues, "I am a Lavignac. The Noble Assembly will not approve of us being an item." "Why not?" you say in as steady a breath as you can muster. $c_He lets go of you, then, dragging a hand through $c_his blond hair. "My family finances many of the other noble houses' endeavors. If we are to be together in a serious capacity, they would see it as my family losing its independence, as their debt being passed on to the throne. That would make them more difficult for you to deal with." <ul> <li>[[″I don't care. I'll do my best to." $c_He gives you a respectful nod. "Good night, Your Majesty." I need a little time to… collect myself." A forced smile, and $c_he flips back into a perfectly polite persona. "Thank you for your time, $mcname_cyril. I wish you a good night." "While the Lavignac have always shared a… symbiotic relationship with the Crown, going as far back as Arcadie's inception, we have maintained a modicum of independence. In exchange for gold, we were allowed to keep our own militia for centuries; you know it today as the Peacekeeping Force, and while it does keep order across the Kingdom, and answers to the Crown, it is financed exclusively by us." $c_His fingers steeple together. "All this to say that, were our relationship to progress further, towards marriage for instance, the Noble Assembly would see it as the end of the Lavignac's independence. "Not responding adequately would put $him in harm's way." "Still, it makes $him sound just as bad as Stan's making $him out to be." "$wilfred, the $King has spoken." $wilfred shakes $w_his head, but says nothing further as Cyril looks down at $c_his book. <<elseif $response == 2>><<set $army_support to $army_support.fm(+10)>> <<set $approval_cyril to $approval_cyril.fm(+10)>> <<set $approval_will to $approval_will.fm(5)>> "Let's turn it on its head." Cyril directs $c_his full attention on you, ready to listen. "Stanislas needs to be beaten at his own game. According to him, the d'Arcadie are blood-thirsty monsters, aren't they? Let's turn it back on him. He murdered my parents in cold blood, while they were unarmed and signing a peace treaty with our oldest enemy. He seized our castle, slaughtering any who would not join his ranks. He's trying to lead the Kingdom into civil war; how much blood would <i>that</i> spill?" You lace your fingers together. "Let us remind the troops of the facts, rather than the fantasy Stanislas is trying to spin." Cyril nods $c_his approval. "You are right, of course. <<elseif $response == 3>><<set $army_support to $army_support.fm(+10)>> <<set $approval_cyril to $approval_cyril.fm(5)>> <<set $approval_will to $approval_will.fm(+10)>> You tear the missive in two. "Let them join him, if they please. I have no need for seditious troops; they'd only be a liability in a fight." Your Commanders stare at you. "Let them know that they are free to leave," you continue, "I need strong men and women at my back, not weaklings who can be so easily swayed by Stanislas's ridiculous rhetoric." "That is—a bold strategy," Cyril opines, but $wilfred nods, saying, "The soldiers will approve of it." "Fair enough." Cyril stares down at $c_his book. <<else>><<set $army_support to $army_support.fm(-10)>> "I'll take my chances," you insist. "Let's just ignore the letter. Responding in the wrong way would be worse than doing nothing." "No change with Stanislas. He is still holed-up in the Royal castle." $c_He pauses for a beat to meet your eyes.<<if $ch16_message != "">> "Your message has reached him, but as we might have expected, he made no answer. "Unchallenged, they would need two months to reach the Royal castle." $w_He stands up, looking down at the map. "We need more soldiers to take them on." "As we discussed the other day, I've sent word to our ally, Arington," Cyril declares. He puts his hood back over his head, and disappears back into the dark alleyway. You wait a few minutes, and check in the alleyway after him; he's gone. He never comes back. After several minutes of fruitless waiting, you decide to go back to the palace. <center><<button [[A Few Days Later...|Ch18_01]]>><</button>></center>"Very well." You signal your guards to leave. They obey with a quick bow. You're alone now. And he chooses that moment to give you the biggest grin, wrinkling the corner of his feline gaze. Before you can comment, he proceeds to pull his red robes over his head in a smooth motion. <ul> <li>[[I look away, out of decency.->Ch17_NathUndress][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[I look away, out of embarrassment.->Ch17_NathUndress][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[I keep staring. He shrugs. <<if $ch17_nat_rom == true>> "I have a hard time performing in front of an audience." <<else>> "They're noisy and distracting. And completely useless here. There is no one for miles."<</if>> <ul> <li>[[″Very well.″->Ch17_GuardGo][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″They stay here, and that's final.″->Ch17_GuardNoFinal][$response = 2]]</li> </ul><<set $aff_nath to $aff_nath.fm(-20)>> <<set $ch17_nat_rom = false>> <<set $ch17_aether_fail = true>> "They stay here, and that's final." He gives a long, exaggerated shrug. "Suit yourself." With that, he walks towards the nearby trees. "Where do you think you're going?" He ignores you, walking inside the forest and disappearing behind the thick trunks. You send your guards after him, to no avail, as they fail to find him. You have no choice but to go back to the palace. <center><<button [[A Few Days Later...|Ch18_01]]>><</button>></center><<if $response == 1>><<set $diplomatic to $diplomatic.fm(+10)>> When you look again, he's left in a long-sleeved front-laced tunic, tucked into cream colored pants. <<elseif $response == 2>><<set $timid to $timid.fm(+10)>> When you look again, he's left in a long-sleeved front-laced tunic, tucked into cream colored pants. <<elseif $response == 3>><<set $timid to $timid.fm(-10)>> Beneath the robes is a long-sleeved front-laced tunic, tucked into cream colored pants. <</if>>He shrugs off the robes with a thinner smile. "It's hot in here," he says by way of explanation, then proceeds to meander around the meadow, robes folded and tucked under his arm. "Aether," he says, loud, then looks back in your direction as he continues, "is everywhere around us. It's in the air we breathe, in the grass we step on, in these trees, in the pools of water collected from the rain." His brown boot scuffs at a barren spot of land, and you notice twigs and rocks have been carefully laid there. He kneels low, pulling something out of his pocket, and, after a few seconds, a flame erupts from the small improvised campfire. "Fire is also a source of Aether," he continues, "the easiest to gather, actually." He stands up, his sharp attention on you as he adds, "It was Ariana's first choice." <ul> <li>[[Hearing her name still brings me pain. "All I'm trying to say is, think of Aether as energy; you can't gather Aether out of a rock, for example… unless it has been previously imbued by another Aether user; but you can gather it from anything that does have energy." With that said, he decides to settle down next to the crackling fire. Moments of silence pass, and he doesn't move nor speak further. <ul> <li>[[″Aren't you supposed to be teaching me something?″->Ch17_NatTeach][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″What should I do now?″->Ch17_NatTeach][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[″What are you sitting there for?″->Ch17_NatTeach][$response = 3]]</li> <li>[[I say nothing, just stare at him.->Ch17_NatTeach][$response = 4]]</li> </ul><<if $response == 1>>"Aren't you supposed to be teaching me something?" As you tread closer, you feel the humid fresh air against your skin, cooling you down from the hot sun rays filtering through the sparse cloud coverage. There is some grass near the edge; you sit down on it, stretch your feet towards the lake, and watch as light bounces off its surface in a hundred of twinkles. You bend a little, hand forward, and the tips of your fingers dip below the surface; chilly, yet not wholly unpleasant. Your whole hand descends into the water, and you feel the cold crawling up your forearm, and through your blood. You close your eyes. The sensation is soothing, somewhat; it is an easy task, to put away, momentarily, every other thought in a corner of your mind, letting it fill instead with the sound of water licking the shore, and the feeling of freshness seeping into your skin. <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<default>><<set $aether += 10>><<set $aether_charge += 10>>You don't know how long it's been, when you shake yourself out of the trance you had slipped into, since you sat down near the bank of Lake Granside. Let's not let them linger in there longer than necessary." <ul> <li>[[″Let's go then.″->Ch18_MeetStanFam][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″Their comfort is the furthest thing from my mind, but the sooner we get this over with, the better.″->Ch18_MeetStanFam][$friendly to $friendly.fm(-10)]]</li> <li>[[″I don't need to see nor hear them. I want them executed.″->Ch18_Exe][$response = 3]]</li> </ul><<if ndef $textGroup>><<set $textGroup = 1>><</if>><<switch $textGroup>> <<case 1>>The dungeons are not actually part of the Palace; there is no reason to sully the luxurious domain with undesirables. Cyril takes you through a back door, past the lavish gardens, calls a group of guards who quickly snap to attention, hurrying to follow and protect the both of you while you step out of the palace through a hidden doorway, climbing ivy serving as a natural disguise for it. It is a maze of lush green natural corridors, sun hidden away by layers of knit metal and branches overhead. At the end of it, another doorway, a black-clad fellow who only nods at Cyril before standing from his seat and unlocking the heavy metal door. You and Cyril enter. <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<default>>It is bleak, inside; a low roof that makes you weary of hitting your head if you stood too tall, a steady humming sound that seems to ooze out of the yellow bulky walls themselves, and a smell of rank food that permeates the air with a sort of disgusting greasiness you can taste with each breath. A scream echoes in the distance, and Cyril barely blinks. "They should be on the floor level," $c_he simply says, moving towards another person in black clothing. They murmur a moment, and you're soon directed towards the left side of the room. Cyril moves, sparing you a glance and an encouraging smile, and stops in front of a locked cell, heavy bars separating you from its occupants. A woman looks up at you from her seat on the floor, eyes black pools of fear in her slender visage. She looks to be in her late forties, black hair peppered with a few silver strands cascading over her slim shoulders as she stands up, burgundy dress unfolding under her. Near her, a young man, in his early-twenties perhaps, is so much the spitting image of Stanislas that your heart seizes up an instant. But it is not him; his hair is much shorter, his eyes bigger and rounder, his countenance utterly different from the man who murdered your whole family. He stands up, wobbling a bit, and grabs a hold of his mother's arm while he stares wide-eyed at you. <<unset $textGroup>><ul> <li>[[″Vesela and Milos, I presume.″->Ch18_MeetVM][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[["″My name is " + $mcname + ". "I want them executed." Cyril turns your way, wide-eyed, slipping out of $c_his usual proper persona to gape at you. "Surely, you jest." <ul> <li>[[″I do not jest. Cut off their heads and send them to Stanislas. Their execution will be a message to anyone who would stand against me." $c_His eyes remain fixed on you, cogs silently turning in $c_his head. "For what crime—would you have them executed?" "Consorting with the enemy." "That's an unsubstantiated accusation." "I decide what is unsubstantiated and what isn't. And I have decided that they are guilty of the crime of treason." $c_He stuffs $c_his book in the crook of $c_his arm. $c_His lips press together, and $c_he takes a wide step sideways, away from you. "The Noble Assembly will not approve. The army will not approve. The citizens, your subjects—they <i>might</i> be swayed, influenced by well-spoken rhetoric, for a little while at least." There is a crinkle between $c_his brows, the absence of $c_his usual smile giving $c_him a cooler air as $c_he turns away. "To maximize the impact of this endeavor, I suggest we move swiftly. The death of Ariana is still fresh in the folks' minds. Publicize an edict, announce the execution, reiterate that this is the fate awaiting traitors. You will gain the respect of a part of the population. Or at least, their attention." "Very well. Tell me everything you know about Stanislas." Vesela twists her hands together, every movement and expression tense. "I am sorry, Your Majesty, but I don't believe there is anything useful either of us could tell you about Stan." She stops, pressing her lips together. Her eyes flicker over to Cyril. "He was a loving son, a generous soul, an idealist at heart. He fought bravely in the Kasri invasions, distinguished himself enough to be made Commander. His father and sister would have been proud, had they survived the war, too." There is a slight bite to her latter words, maybe brought on by fear, probably by grief. "I don't know why he decided to turn against your family, or who helped him. I only have letters he used to send from the north. She blinks perplexed brown eyes at you. "There isn't much to say," she replies. "I am Vesela Duval. I administer our lands in the stead of my late husband, and watch over the part of our border that meets with the southern front." Her shoulders bunch together, and she breaths out deliberately slowly before adding, "I've had parts of my estate burned down more times than I can recall, but I suppose that can't be helped. We need to push back the southern tribes, don't we?" You can sense her resisting the urge to give a shrug, and she looks away. <ul> <<if not hasVisited ("Ch18_info")>><li>[[″Information. Warmth. It permeates the air, crawling up your skin, and there is soon a bead of sweat forming at your forehead. Smoke. Its smell is not unpleasant, the burning wood scent sticking to you; it will not come off unless you wash it off thoroughly, will stay in your hair and clothes to remind you of this moment. Wisps and cracks, flames twirling skyward, hot blood in your veins making you feel feverish with each heartbeat. <center><<button [[Next|Ch18_Nath5]]>><</button>></center>Fresh water splashes in front of you, and the cold droplets landing on your cheeks almost startle you. "I do have a few pointers," he says, "though I don't know how useful they'll be to you." He catches a blade of grass between thumb and forefinger, snapping it in two. "Ariana, for instance," he continues, "described it as making Aether flow through and out of her, in a pattern that she had previously visualized. She said she would first feel the energy inside her, then direct it outward in whichever way she needed at the time; though she also said it was mostly instincts, and that she couldn't really describe it, so make of that what you will." <ul> <li>[[″Isn't there anything useful in all those books of yours?″->Ch18_Nath7][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″What about other Aether users?″->Ch18_Nath7][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[I say nothing.->Ch18_Nath7][$response = 3]]</li> </ul><<if $response == 1>>You mull over it a moment. Another one—Diane—is said to having routinely entered a dreamlike state during combat, and every time she used Aether—and every single time she did, it was to destroy entire battalions, or raze whole cities to the ground, so." He shrugs. "These are old tales; I would not use them as a point of reference." He tosses the grass in his fingers, and stands up. "You have managed to use Aether before, haven't you?" You nod. "I have. But it wasn't an entirely conscious process." "What did you feel, back then?" What you felt, back then, was… When Ariana had just been killed before your eyes. When you had just fled with your life, and found yourself hounded again through the forest. When some pretentious soldier started mocking you from the other side of the open gates of Fort Queenscliff, while you didn't even have enough strength to stand… <ul> <li>[[I felt anger.->Ch18_Nath8][$aether_feeling = "anger"]]</li> <li>[[I felt despair.->Ch18_Nath8][$aether_feeling = "despair"]]</li> <li>[[I felt vengeful.->Ch18_Nath8][$aether_feeling = "vengeance"]]</li> <li>[[I felt righteous.->Ch18_Nath8][$aether_feeling = "justice"]]</li> <li>[[I felt drained.->Ch18_Nath8][$aether_feeling = "drained"]]</li> <li>[[I felt sorrow.->Ch18_Nath8][$aether_feeling = "sorrow"]]</li> <li>[[I felt nothing.->Ch18_Nath8][$aether_feeling = "nothing"]]</li> </ul>"Whatever it was," Nathaniel says, "maybe try and put yourself back in that particular mental state?" <ul> <li>[[″I'd rather not.″->Ch18_Nath9][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[I nod.->Ch18_Nath9][$response = 2]]</li> </ul><<if $response == 1>>"I'd rather not," you reply. You breathe in, taking in the humid, fresh air, and will yourself to focus only on the illusory image of a roaring fire. You visualize it, down to the last flame, dancing in front of you, warming your limbs and the air around you, its scent getting into your clothes, into your hair, hard to wash off. You keep your focus sustained, not letting it wander even as scurrying ants seem to run right under the sensitive skin of your fingertips. You breathe out, letting out the warmth, the light, the smoke, the embers; you know how it feels, how it would scorch you if you were to be foolish enough to let your limbs anywhere near it; how your eyes would dry and water if you were to stare too long at it. Fire. Destructive force, yet indispensable to life. You know very well how fire feels. A wave of tingles travels from the back of your skull to your temples, and you can't help but blink your eyes open when it hits your vision with thousands of stars. The fire before you is lit. "Not bad," Nathaniel says right<<if $ch17_nat_rom == true>> next to you,<<else>> behind you,<</if>> making you swivel to catch his eye. "Try and make it happen more quickly, next time." <center><<button [[Next|Ch18_Focus2]]>><</button>></center><<if $response == 1>>"Why are you so unpleasant?" "Unpleasant?" he says, spinning around. "This is not me being unpleasant, $mcname_nath." "This is you being what, then? Perfectly polite and amicable?" "Aren't I?" His smile turns into a wolfish grin. "Not really, no." He drops the pretense of a smile, then, his brown eyes focusing on you while a sparrow sings a light melody above your heads. "I see no point in uttering words I don't truly think," he says eventually. "This world is full enough of falsehoods as it is." Silence reigns for a beat, but before you can ask him to elaborate, Nathaniel sighs. "I really don't have all day, $mcname_nath. Please try and work on the fire." <<elseif $response == 2>>"There is no need to be so… aggressive." His left cheek rises in an expression of puzzlement. I'd rather avoid fighting, if I can help it." "Commendable attitude, if not thoroughly unrealistic," he retorts. "Stanislas wants you dead. Do not allow yourself to forget that." <</if>>He edges a little closer. "I know of a way, or at least, I believe I do. I've unfortunately never been able to verify whether the process would be effective or not."
