At first, it is a simple meeting of lips; you hear, feel Nathaniel breathing you in as both his hands now cradle your face. But then he's licking you, the very tip of his tongue gently easing its way under your upper lip; he pulls you close, flush against him, to taste your mouth, to inhale your scent, to stroke your skin. Blood rushes into your ears. You find yourself on the floor, over a soft carpet, limbs entangled with Nathaniel's; you realize your clothes are gone, not sure how or when that happened; but the feeling of a warm body right against you, overflowing with desire for you, makes you drop that train of thought and unable to focus on anything but the wave of pleasure that grows inside you. Minutes pass—hours? days? You can't tell. You don't care. In this moment, you can only care about pleasure. Insatiable, a vortex that begins with you and ends with Nathaniel, with his black hair in your fingers and his fingers everywhere over you, bringing you to the edge and over it time and time again. You gasp his name, and he laughs—like you've just told him the most preposterous joke in the world. His kisses taste of cedar, his skin smells of incense, and his touch feels like heaven. You never want it to stop, yet— As he stares down at you, your body and his intertwined in a feverish embrace, the mischievous glow of his irises catches your attention, the haughtiness at its edges making you wonder. Should you really be doing this? <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<default>>You snap awake as your carriage stops in the middle of your gardens, in your palace. "Lying to, and betraying Arington would cause disruptions that we would all be better off without." A sweet melody fills the air, slow and cheery, just loud enough to drown out the buzz from multiple private conversations, but not enough to prevent attendees from carrying said conversations. Your bluntness has $a_him raising an eyebrow. "I can't really blame you," you continue, "a young, inexperienced $king, up against a veteran commander with passionate troops at his back, aided by a country driven by hate and resentment after centuries of war. "Were I to marry you and die in battle against Stanislas, as my spouse, you would still be entitled to some riches; were I to live, well, you'd have all the benefits of having me as a spouse. I understand why you're pushing for it; it's a win-win situation for you. "On the other hand, were I to die without Arington's troops' involvement, you'd have the advantage of having had no connection to me or my reign; you'd be able to negotiate terms of peace and commerce with Stanislas on a blank slate, unencumbered by links to my family, even though you claim you'd do no such thing." $a_His head shakes side-to-side in silent disagreement, the air of someone politely listening to absurdities; yet, $a_he listens, and you know you're getting closer to the truth. "Except, were I to die, Arcadie will not lie down and let Stanislas take power; the Noble Assembly will not stand for it. The fighting will continue; it might devolve into civil war, it might not." <ul> <li>[[″Unless that's what you're counting on.″->Ch20_AnafelGetTroops][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[Never mind.->Ch20_AnafelNevermind2][$response = 2]]</li> </ul><<set $GoThroughA = true>> "He could go through Kalltland," you counter. "This way, Your Majesty." She guides you through the fort, taking you to the training grounds where you are able to observe your soldiers practicing their sword skills. They pay you only a moderate amount of attention, perhaps not wanting to seem distracted before their commanding officers. Nearby, some are busy putting the last touches to a couple of impressive siege weapons, built of wood and steel. <<if $politics >= 50>> Two trebuchets, one slightly larger than the other, are almost ready to rain down destruction on your enemies. There is a distinct lack of belfries or ladders, however; building a couple of those would perhaps have been a more astute choice, as you're planning on attacking a castle. <</if>>You soon reach the vicinity of the armory. Its door is ajar, and as Valerie comments on the worsening weather, you take a peek inside. Swords and shields, bows and lances. Nothing out of the ordinary, except for a dozen barrels stacked in the darkest corner, half-hidden behind a mound of hay. <ul> <li>[[I inquire about the barrels.->Ch21_Barrels][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[I don't see why barrels should warrant my attention.->Ch21_Barrels][$response = 2]]</li> </ul><<if $response == 1>><<set $ch21_barrels = true>> "Remnants from the Kasri invasions," Cyril clarifies. "They're effectively bombs, made of a mix of sulfur and oil." "We're not planning on making use of them," Valerie adds with a circumspect smile. "Why is that?" you inquire. "They are far, <i>far</i> too volatile," she replies. "The last time we tried ended in… tragedy." "The last time we made actual use of them was during the Kasri invasions," Cyril explains. "Nathaniel might have told you about this. But that was ten years ago. They're definitely not as stable as they should be. We'll have to figure out a way to safely dispose of them, someday." You find yourself lingering on your balcony, late one afternoon, hands flat on the white marble railing, eyes lost on the horizon, over the explosion of color as the sun slips below your capital and its myriad buildings. He touches a finger to his lower lip. "How much Aether could it hold, I wonder? Does it have a point of catastrophic failure if you pump too much power into it?" He then slides a pensive gaze at you. "Let's give you back your blood, then, shall we?" he says, clapping his hands together. Half-turning away, he goes back to searching through his satchel. About five seconds later, he looks up, over his shoulder, careful gaze gauging you. "There is no need to panic," he assures you, which only causes the beginning of worry to sprout in your mind. When he next faces you, it is with a vial of red blood in hand. Light catches the glass, reflecting shades of yellow and grass. Strange, how the reflection seems to move with a will of its own… You stare as you realize the glow the blood is giving off is not at all a reflection, but a dim light from within; ruby, gold and emerald, an ever-changing shimmer slowly moving through your blood, a never-stopping wave of color that could send you into a daze. "I have infused it with as much Aether as was possible," Nathaniel explains, rapt attention on the vial, brown eyes mesmerized and glinting with fascination at the liquid in his hand. "With this running through your veins, you will be powerful enough to write legends of your own. Your name will be remembered for eons to come." His tone is slow, unnervingly so; you feel he is speaking directly inside your head, and when you blink up at his brown, dark eyes, reflecting the otherworldly glow, you're not sure it's just your imagination. <ul> <li>[[″I am not putting this inside my veins.″->Ch21_NathNo][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[I nod for him to inject it back in my arm.->Ch21_Nathinject][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[″What is happening?″ This is all so strange.->Ch21_Nathwhat][$response = 3]]</li> </ul>"No. They stay and that's final." He pulls a metallic apparatus out of his satchel; it looks like a bent out of shape, hollowed out pair of scissors. He inserts the blood vial into it, and attaches a long, hair-thin needle at its end. The flicker of a match, and he holds a flame under the tip of the needle for a few seconds. "Let us begin," he says. He takes hold of your proffered arm, turning it inside up, baring the crook of your elbow and grazing the blue veins there. Was this really wise? Did you really make the right choice? Your breathing picks up despite yourself—perhaps an effect of the Aether? Nathaniel pulls the needle out, applies pressure with a clean cloth, and— It is as sudden as it is painful; white light blinds you—you reflexively squeeze your eyes shut, but the light does not abate, for it does not come from outside but rather from within; and your head—it <i>hurts</i> so much you can't help but grind your teeth together. "Breathe," Nathaniel's voice says in your ear, and you can feel his hands clasped over your shoulders. "Breathe, $mcname. This power is yours, but you have to subdue it." Subdue it? How are you supposed— "Stop asking questions," he says, "and start taking action. The power flowing through you; should you fail to tame it, it will kill you." Kill you? "Yes. Now. Stop fighting it, just let it flow. <i>Breathe</i>." You try loosening your fists, unclenching your jaw, simply drawing a breath—but you <i>can't</i>. "You <i>can</i>. There is nothing you can't do, $mcname. So you go looking for Nathaniel in the training grounds. He is nowhere to be found. Your guards report that he has left the castle some two hours ago. You grab a horse, ride to his home. You arrive as night falls. No light filters out of his house. You knock, and there is no answer. You enter, and there is no presence. <ul> <li>[[″Nathaniel?″->Ch21_looknath2][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″What in the world did you do to me?″->Ch21_looknath2][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[″You'd better come out at once!″->Ch21_looknath2][$response = 3]]</li> </ul>You decide you do not care enough to go looking for Nathaniel, and return to sleep. <center><<button [[Two Days Later...|Ch22_01]]>><</button>></center><<if $response == 1>>"Nathaniel?" you call. <<elseif $response == 2>>"What in the world did you do to me?" you ask out loud. <<elseif $response == 3>>"You'd better come out at once!" you threaten. <</if>>Only the echo of your own voice answers you. You remain in the dark, alone, for a few moments, mind racing. A shiver travels down your back, and you whirl around; nothing, just the half-opened front door squeaking in the breeze. But then— Did you just hear a whisper? You whip around again—there's something moving on the wall— <<if $aether_2ndSkill == true || $ch17_nat_rom == true>><center><<button [[Next|Ch21_NathHome]]>><</button>></center><<else>>You jump before realizing it is only your own shadow. You decide to return to the palace for now. <center><<button [[Two Days Later...|Ch22_01]]>><</button>></center><</if>><<if ndef $textGroup>><<set $textGroup = 1>><</if>><<switch $textGroup>> <<case 1>>You see it, barely, a remnant of something, there but not really there; a shadow on your retina as you stare unseeingly at your own shadow over the wall. An impetus pushes you forward, and you climb the spiral staircase two steps at a time. The door at the top is locked, iron bars and wood, but you push it, Aether at your fingertips, flatten your palm over its lock, sending heat into it and rendering it useless. It creaks open. You advance. Nothing. No one. A whisper of a shadow on the wall again. Goosebumps erupting over your skin. Sweat pearling at your hairline. You step fully inside the room. The door flies shut behind you. <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<case 2>>You spin around, and <i>he</i>'s there. "Nathaniel." Arms crossed, he grins, showing his teeth. "Whatever are you looking for, <<if $ch17_nat_rom == false>> $mcname?" <<else>> my dear?"<</if>> "What did you do to me?" "Exactly what you requested; you're as powerful as Aether-wielders of legend, perhaps even more. Just as I promised." Your vision blurs, and his voice echoes inside your head. "I might have kept some of your blood for myself, if that's what you're wondering." You start; he's suddenly right in your face, and his hands shoot up to grab at your shoulders. Your thoughts freeze. You can't move. "Don't worry, $mcname. We will meet again. For now, I have business to attend to, and so do you. Go and defeat Stanislas. You can look for me afterwards." He leans closer, whispers against your skin, "I'll watch, as you write legends of your own." <<if $ch17_nat_rom == true>> Warmth—a kiss, at the seam of your lips.<</if>> <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<default>>You jump. You're back downstairs, in the living room, alone, with nothing but quiet shadows all around you. You blink, feeling constricted, your motions restricted; you can almost feel the gloom climbing over you, threatening to drown you. Surely, it can be nothing more than your imagination. But your hair stands on end, dread creeping along your spine, your breathing devolving into gasps. It takes the whole of your willpower to dash outside. In the silence of night, you fight to quiet the hammering of your heart in your chest under the cautious, if blasé, gaze of your royal guards. You can only return to the palace for now. <<unset $textGroup>><center><<button [[Two Days Later...|Ch22_01]]>><</button>></center><</switch>><<if def $textGroup>><<set $textGroup += 1>><</if>>$elena stands in front of you, $his smooth features drawn in harsh shadows, cast by candles and your Aether chandeliers. Lord Asher seems stunned, mouth open around an unspoken word. As he makes to stand, a bitter tightness across his features, his wife clamps down on his arm, and she stands in his stead, speaking loudly, "House Villiers stands with $mcname." Cyril nods, pacing across the podium, turning $c_his silent attention towards the rest of the Assembly. More and more nobles make to stand, under $c_his unwavering gaze. You press your eyes closed, willing your ancestral power to free you. Your eyelids fly open as lightning shoots down your forearms, passes through the lines you've pressed into the stone above you. A deafening crack, and rocks loudly burst into debris. You are free. Your lungs no longer constrained, you can finally breathe, and as stones finish crashing all around you, you make to stand, chunks of stones sliding off you as you blink your weary eyes at your surroundings. <<else>> <<set $Health -= 10>> You brace yourself as pain stabs through you, searing heat from shoulder to fingertips; you grit your teeth through it, feeling the familiar prickle of Aether running through you, aiding you as you push again. Something gives. A crack, then another, and the surface above you explodes into hundreds of debris. They crumble away, and you are free, rocks sliding off you as you get back to your feet. You blink weary eyes at your surroundings.<</if>> <center><<button [[Next|Ch23_02]]>><</button>></center>You find yourself in a large hallway, or rather, what is left of it. Rubble and bricks form a rocky mound in the middle. The ceiling has been pulverized, letting you glimpse the hall of the Assembly above as you crane your neck upwards. The space is swimming in thick dust and embers, dying sunlight spilling through tall glass windows, one of them shattered. Your ears pick up a concerning noise; somewhere near, but not close enough to pose an immediate threat, echoes of battle ring out; the clash of swords across the hallways and the gardens outside. It seems the palace is under attack. You step out of the gravel, and, looking around, you spot a shred of vivid fabric, the ends of luxurious robes now crushed under heavy debris. You're apparently not the only one who's found themselves trapped under rocks. We need to get you to safety." <<elseif $response == 4>>The sounds of battle, the rattle of blades echoing through nearby halls and outside the Palace's walls, have not diminished. "The Palace is under attack," you say. "We have to defend it." <<if $ch23_companion == "will">> "From the sound of it, our soldiers are already on it," $wilfred replies. <<else>> Cyril frowns. "We will. But we need to get you to safety, first."<</if>> <</if>>Your heads snap around as sudden, quick steps fill the air with sharp noise, reverberating through the long palace corridors. Regular, steady, almost synchronized; most likely soldiers. Yours or the enemy's, is the burning question. <<if $ch23_companion == "will">> $wilfred dashes in front of you, sword already out of its scabbard, as a dozen soldiers emerge out of the corner of a perpendicular passageway.<<else>> You keep a hand at your hip, gripping the handle of your sword just as a dozen soldiers emerge out of the corner of a perpendicular passageway.<</if>> As they appear, you quickly scan their uniforms. Blue, gold detailing; Arcadian army. "Your Majesty!" Your gaze tracks the female voice, source of the call. A woman, fully armored, auburn hair peaking out of her steel helmet, rust-colored eyes trained on you. You blink, recognition washing over you. "Lady Valerie?" She nods. "You're unharmed, that's a relief! Your Majesty, Stanislas's forces are on the verge of overwhelming the palace guards; we need to leave at once!" <ul> <li>[[″Alright, lead the way.″->Ch23_ValLead][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″What are you doing here?″->Ch23_ValWhat][$response = 2]]</li> </ul>"Alright, lead the way." <<if $ch21_thomas_dungeons == false && $pacifist >= 50 && $ch21_thomas_talk == true>> <<set $ch23_thomas_friendly = true>> She quickly nods. "This way, Your Majesty," she says, dashing away towards the way she came. You prepare to follow, but one of her soldiers suddenly stands before you, blocking your path. "Your Majesty," he says, voice low, and you recognize Lieutenant Thomas's earnest brown eyes. "Don't." Behind him, you see Valerie whirling around, staring wide-eyed at the pair of you. "It's a trap." He licks his chapped lips. Valerie unsheathes her sword. "We're with Stanislas," Thomas says, and Valerie sprints your way.<<elseif $ch23_companion == "cyril">> She quickly nods. "This way, Your Majesty," she says, preparing to dash away, towards the way she came. You make to follow, but Cyril's voice arrests you. "Valerie. There is no way you could have arrived at the Palace this quickly—" Valerie swivels around, stares with narrowed eyes as Cyril continues, "Unless your departure, by some very strange fluke, coincided with Stanislas's." "There is—" she begins. But impatience soon spills across her features, and, lips pressed in frustration, she drops all pretense at fealty, unsheathing her sword. "So be it! Seize the $King!"<<else>> She quickly nods. "This way, Your Majesty," she says, preparing to dash away, towards the way she came. You prepare to follow, but $wilfred blocks your path. "Valerie. As $c_he pulls a survivor out of the rubble, part of you almost wishes $c_he hadn't. Cyril watches it crash to the floor, then moves slowly into the crevice you've just cleared. Whatever $c_he sees there startles $c_him, and $c_he quickly reaches into it, arm outstretched. Something in your gaze gives Valerie pause; or perhaps it is the fact that, sword now firmly in hand, you must seem less of an easy target. <<if $ch23_companion == "will">> Valerie makes to attack you, but $wilfred decisively stands in her way, and as Valerie's soldiers spread out, most of them have to engage the Peacekeeping Force, instead of you.<<else>> Valerie makes to attack you, but the Peacekeeping Force decisively stands in her way, and as Valerie's soldiers spread out, clearly aiming to get to you, they have to contend with the men and women under Cyril's command.<</if>> Though they are dedicated, they are injured, tired, and outnumbered, and you don't expect them to hold the enemy off forever. To your left, a soldier manages to pass through; he wastes no time before aiming a strike at your shoulder. You step back, letting his momentum carry him into the path of your own upward slice. Your blade catches his underarm, and he screams next to your ear as you elbow him away, just in time to parry another blade with the flat of yours. <<if $sword >= 50>> Instinct and hours of practice propel you,<<else>> You move mostly on instinct,<</if>> thought processes receding to the background as the whole of your being focuses on countering, slicing and slashing. As sweat pearls at your forehead, there is a spike of sensation right at the base of your skull, the familiar sting of Aether crawling down your spine. It spreads, needle-like, throughout your limbs. Lighter, faster—you feel renewed, motions effortless now, and you're whirling away to avoid a strike only to return your own before your opponent has even finished his attempt at hitting you. They're too slow, or perhaps you are too quick; despite the growing darkness, despite the pain flashing in your shoulders, by the time it takes you to discard them all, you wonder if this is how fighting felt like to Ariana; so easy you find yourself growing careless by the end, leaving yourself open to attacks at your back because you <i>know</i> you'll be able to react in time regardless. A clash of metal as a helmet bounces off the floor, and you find yourself in the middle of a bloodbath spilled by your hand, sprays of the hot red liquid on the floor, on the walls, sticking to your sleeves. Gasps and death rattles fill the silence you've successfully imposed. <center><<button [[Next|Ch23_FightAether2]]>><</button>></center><<set $army_support to $army_support.fm(+5)>>You brace yourself. The plan is to reach the rear of the Palace, where you know a secret exit lies. You run through the halls, noises of battle still reaching, but you can tell you are indeed traveling farther and farther from the worst of it. Your group forks into a new passage, and over your own hard breathing and the cacophonous clatter of armor, you're still able to clearly hear the surprised yelp the man at the front suddenly lets out. "Turn back!" You're unable to make out the reason for his alarm, as the nearest soldier instantly grips your arm and pulls you in the opposite direction. <center><<button "Next" `passage()`>><</button>></center> <<default>>As it turns out, pulling you away is futile; more soldiers block your retreat; more of Stanislas's sympathizers. <<if $ch23_companion == "cyril">> You hear Cyril calling out behind you, "$mcname_cyril! Be careful!"<<else>> "$mcname! Stay close!" $wilfred bellows behind you,<</if>> just as the clash of swords fills your ears. Your gaze stops over a familiar figure; not Arcadian, too tall to be, their armor nothing like your soldiers', roughly hammered in and adorned with pelts; short blond hair, icy eyes that seem to want to pierce your heart. Vallmar. One of the two Kalltland emissaries that were at the farce of a peace treaty signing, the meeting that ended in your parents' murder, that set in motion all the events that led to Ariana's death, all the events that brought you here. He has a smirk for you, a split-second expression that lasts only as long as he needs to level his bow at your head. <<if $ch18_Aether2 == true>> Your body moves of its own volition. You hear the arrow speeding past you as your sword comes up to deflect it, the screech of metal on metal tensing your jaw and sending more adrenaline into your veins.<<else>> <<set $Health -= 10>> You blink. A fast-moving object, too fast for you to follow, for you to evade, plunges itself into your upper chest, missing your neck by mere inches. You stare at its shaft protruding from your body. Crimson blooms around it, tainting your uniform, but the adrenaline flooding your veins dampens the pain that might have otherwise overwhelmed you. <</if>> In the ruckus, Vallmar lets out a sharp laugh. <<unset $textGroup>><ul> <li>[[I will make him pay for his treachery.->Ch23_FightVallmar][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[This isn't for revenge's sake, but I have to face him all the same.->Ch23_FightVallmar][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[I have to escape!->Ch23_VallEscape][$response = 3]]</li> </ul><</switch>><<if def $textGroup>><<set $textGroup += 1>><</if>>You brace yourself for battle;<<if $ch23_companion == "cyril">> Cyril and $c_his men<<else>> $wilfred and the guards<</if>> are occupied with the rest of Stanislas's soldiers, and you rush past the melee to come face-to-face with Vallmar. He quickly trades his bow for a sword, its edge uneven and curved outwards, and he watches you with a hawkish gaze and a scornful smile as you approach. <ul> <li>[[″I hope you're ready to die.″->Ch23_FightVallmar2][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″Enjoy laughing while you can, Vallmar.″->Ch23_FightVallmar2][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[″I'll make you wish you stayed up north, Kalltlander.″->Ch23_FightVallmar2][$response = 3]]</li> <li>[[″I suppose asking you to lay down your weapons would be futile.″->Ch23_FightVallmar2][$response = 4]]</li> <li>[[Words are of no use, now. I prepare myself for the upcoming fight.->Ch23_FightVallmar2][$response = 5]]</li> </ul><<set $Health -= 10>> <<set $army_support to $army_support.fm(-10)>> You spin around, the impetus to run, to <i>survive</i>, making you dash through your soldiers. A whiz, and a stab of pain through your shoulder blade sends you crashing to the floor. "$mcname!" <<if $ch23_companion == "will">> A familiar hand hoists you up, only to throw you aside against the wall. The shock jars you hard enough to knock the wind out of you. "Stay down!" <<else>> A familiar hand pulls you quickly aside, against the wall. "Protect the $King!" you hear Cyril's voice above you.<</if>> You curl onto yourself, a reflexive move that puts your head out of reach, and wait, heart beating a staccato in your chest, as the sounds of battle—blades, arrows, screams—sound all around you. It lasts an eternity, it seems, and when silence suddenly reigns again, you have a hard time unclamping your hands from around your head. When you finally manage to glance up, you find death all around. A haphazard mess of corpses; Arcadian soldiers, Peacekeeping Force, and Vallmar in the middle of it all. <<if $ch23_companion == "will">> $wilfred wordlessly helps you up. Blood is smeared all over the left side of $w_his face, down $w_his uniform, running down $w_his blade; none of it $w_his_p. $w_His intense gaze snags on the arrow protruding from your back. $w_He snaps it in two without a word, leaving the tip inside your muscles. <<else>> Cyril helps you stand, and frowns at the arrow protruding from your back.<</if>> <center><<button [[Next|Ch23_VallmarDead]]>><</button>></center>Silence suddenly returns to the bloodied corridor. The last light shimmers through the tall windows at your side, ghost of a day that's ending in blood. He swivels away with a scream and a hand over his eye. You leave him no time to recover, following him with the tip of your sword driven through the back of his unprotected neck. You blink when you realize your weapon didn't only slice through flesh, inflicting a fatal wound and nothing more; it went through and out of his sword-wielding arm, separating it from his body; Vallmar can only fumble onwards, momentum driving him to the wall and making him crash there. You move on instinct, parrying your family's blade with the one in your palm; the shock rattles you, forcing you into a backward step. There is a heaviness to Ariana's blade when it meets yours, a strange, dark drag that sucks the breath out of you, that drains your strength out of your limbs when you deflect it. Something is wrong. You feel sluggish, reflexes weighted, throat dry, a loud buzzing noise in your ears. Stanislas is unperturbed, icily placid as he strikes downward, sideward, chasing you as you sidestep, evading you as you counterattack. You soon see an opening, however; avoiding your slash turns him half-away, his blade momentarily on his other side. The shield is, for a split-second, right in front of you. You have to be mindful not to send any Aether-fueled strike into it. Stanislas's eyes meet with yours. Sullen, you think, as he unfolds his shielded arm, aiming for your midsection. "Please, don't do this to me." <<elseif $response == 3>>"Cyril," you say, forcing your voice into a steady tone, "you need to stay awake." <</if>>$c_He hums again. $c_His chest barely rises. You touch $c_his cheek, marred with blood. $c_He feels so cold. "Stay with me, Cyril." $c_He does not move. "Cyril!" $c_His hazel eyes snap open, lock with yours for an instant. "I never thought," $c_he whispers, "to come up with a good dying wish." <ul> <li>[[″Don't say that! You're not dying!″->Ch23_Cyrildies2][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″Cyril...″->Ch23_Cyrildies2][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[″...No time like the present.″->Ch23_Cyrildies2][$response = 3]]</li> </ul><<if $response == 1>>"Don't say that! You're not dying!" Vehemently, you cling onto $c_him. <<elseif $response == 2>>"Cyril…" You feel the telltale prickle of tears at the corners of your eyes, a lump in your throat you force yourself to swallow around. <<elseif $response == 3>>You breathe. "...No time like the present." <</if>>You look down to see $c_his hand—bloody and weak—grasping at your jacket. "Could you… kiss me?" $c_he requests. So you do. You gather $c_him close, and press your mouth to $c_his_p in a soft, feather-light kiss. $c_His lips are ice cold, and taste of copper. $c_His grip falters, and $c_his hand slips off of your clothes. When you pull back, you know $c_his eyes will never open again. <center><<button [[Next|Ch23_ROdead]]>><</button>></center><<if ndef $textGroup>><<set $textGroup = 1>><</if>><<switch $textGroup>> <<case 1>>Blood pounds in your ears. You slowly, carefully lay $ROname down on the floor, and rise to your feet. The soles of your boots squelch over the bloodied tiles. As you stand above Stanislas, <<if $ArianaSword == false>> you remember your weapon was destroyed earlier, so you search for another one. Ariana's sword, embellished pommel and blade of lustered lutecium, is within reach. So you reclaim it. <<else>> you remember you dropped your sword earlier, so you search for it. It isn't far; you can't exactly miss it, its embellished pommel and blade of lustered lutecium making it shine in the dim light.<</if>> The low buzz it sends into your palm as you retrieve it is strangely familiar. Something in its cadence, in its rhythm in your veins, reminds you of the voice of your sister. A sister whose murderer is presently lying at your feet. A murderer who has also taken $ROname's life, who has taken your whole family's lives. Effectively, Stanislas has killed everyone you ever cared for. I intend to put him to work." $w_He arches a brow. "What?" "He'll help undo the mess he created," you clarify. That seems to befuddle $w_him only further. "I have a hard time imagining him helping us with anything… but I will trust your judgment." <<else>> "He's alive. For now." $w_He nods.<</if>> <<if $aether_blood_taken == true>> $w_He then levels a serious gaze at you. "I've heard from the nurses that Nathaniel has gone and disappeared. I don't trust him. We should look for him." <<if $aether_blood_injected == true>> "No." The word passes your lips, unbidden. "We wouldn't be able to find him, anyway," your mouth says, with no input from your brain. "He'll reappear soon enough." $wilfred stares at you with a strange expression. A sound like a pop rings beside your ear, and you blink, as if jerking awake. Your mind is blank. What were you talking about? "Are you alright?" asks $wilfred. You part your lips to reply, but the truth is, you have no idea why $w_he would ask you that. You are perfectly alright, after all. "Yes," you confidently say. You don't want to worry $wilfred. Since there is nothing to worry about.<<set $response = 0>> <center><<button [[Next|VisitWill3]]>><</button>></center><<else>><ul> <li>[[″I agree. He has some of my blood.″->VisitWill3][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″No. He'll reappear when he'll want to.″->VisitWill3][$response = 2]]</li> </ul><</if>><<else>><center><<button [[Next|VisitWill3]]>><</button>></center><</if>><<if $response == 1>>"I agree. He has some of my blood in his possession." "All the more reason to track him down." <<elseif $response == 2>>"I don't think we'd be able to find him. I'm sure he'll reappear soon enough." "Alright." <</if>>$w_He pulls on your hand, now. "We've talked enough. Come near me, $mcname." You slide next to $w_him in the warm bed, and $w_he holds onto you, soon dozing off against your shoulder. <center><<button [[Next|BackToCastle]]>><</button>></center>The cellars are dark and damp, cold sneaking into your bones as you carefully descend a long flight of stairs. Your pulse quickens when you spot them; three open wood coffins, lit up in an orange glow by the torch $Helper is holding above your heads. You step forward, glimpse their faces, and freeze. There is blood; over your parents' throats, dried over their bluish skin and clothes, across Ariana's face and chest, tainting the gold emblem of Arcadie in deep crimson. Your mother's blond hair is loose, strands of it over the shoulders of her black dress, almost hiding the gash in the middle of her neck; your father lies next to her, his almost serene expression marred by his torn throat; and Ariana— Her eyes are open, glassy green orbs staring sightlessly at the ceiling; you must be imagining it, but you feel sadness in her lifeless gaze. The longing for a different fate. <center><<button [[Next|BackToCastle2]]>><</button>></center><<if $response == 1>>"What purpose would that have accomplished?" you reply, slowing your step. "You still have your whole life in front of you." <<elseif $response == 2>>"I hope mercy will make you rethink the path you've chosen," you reply. "Only aimless death lies at its end." <<elseif $response == 3>>"If you're so keen on dying," you reply, barely slowing your step, "take it into your own hands. I'm not an executioner." <</if>>She blinks, a stupefied frown across her face. One of your guards orders her to sit back down, and she does in silence. <<include SkipLilia>>It is obvious that they are dead. But the closer you come, the colder you feel; your very breath is turning into visible, white puffs of air. <<if $Helper == $wilfred>> "I don't know what Stanislas has done," $wilfred says behind you, "or what his Kalltlander acolytes did, but it seems to have prevented any decay."<<else>> "Whatever Stanislas has done," Cyril says behind you, "it seems to have allowed them to remain… intact."<</if>> You swallow, staring at your kin lying dead before you. Reminding you that you are the last living member of your line.<<set $ParentsAriana = 0>> <<include ParentsLoop>><ul> <<if not hasVisited ("ParentsSorry") && $ParentsAriana == 0>><li>[[″I'm sorry.″->ParentsSorry]]</li><</if>> <<if not hasVisited ("ParentsMiss") && $ParentsAriana == 0>><li>[[″I miss you.″->ParentsMiss]]</li><</if>> <<if not hasVisited ("ParentsAvenge") && $ch23_MCKilledStan == true>><li>[[″You've been avenged.″->ParentsAvenge]]</li><</if>> <li>[[I cry.->ParentsCry]]</li> <li>[[I turn away.->TurnParents]]</li> </ul><<set $ParentsAriana += 1>> "I'm sorry," you say. <<include ParentsLoop>><<set $ParentsAriana += 1>> "I miss you," you say. <<include ParentsLoop>>"You've been avenged," you declare. <<include ParentsLoop>>It all comes crashing down, guilt and grief, sadness and dread, loneliness and fear; you let the tears roll down your cheeks, you let the sobs tear away the silence, you let yourself feel the pain, the weight of your loss and the emptiness gnawing at your very soul. <<if $Helper == $wilfred && $lockedin_will == true>> $wilfred pulls you into a hug, torch abandoned; $w_his warm embrace grounds you, reminds you that while your kin is no more, you are not completely alone. <<elseif $Helper == "Cyril" && $lockedin_cyril == true>> Cyril pulls you into a hug, torch abandoned; $c_his warm embrace grounds you, reminds you that while your kin is no more, you are not completely alone. <<elseif $Helper == $wilfred && $aff_will >= 60>> You feel $wilfred's hand over your shoulder; it grounds you, reminds you that while your kin is no more, you are not completely alone. <<elseif $Helper == "Cyril" && $aff_cyril >= 60>> You feel Cyril's hand over your shoulder; it grounds you, reminds you that while your kin is no more, you are not completely alone.<</if>> You need a moment to get your breathing back under control. $Helper does not rush you. <<include BackToCastle3>>You step back. <<include BackToCastle3>>"Regarding their funeral," $Helper says eventually, voice subdued, "I understand the d'Arcadie have historically been buried in Goldridge. It would be a very big affair, very public. You could also decide to have them buried here, in the Royal castle's gardens; your parents preferred the castle to Goldridge, in any case." <ul> <li>[[″We'll bury them here.″->CastleEnd][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″Goldridge it is, then.″->CastleEnd][$response = 2]]</li> </ul><<if $response == 1>>"We'll bury them here." <<elseif $response == 2>>"Goldridge it is, then." <</if>>$Helper nods. You leave the Royal castle behind, your old life with it. <center><<button [[Next|AfterCastle]]>><</button>></center>Over the following days, you hear that what remains of Stanislas's<<if $army_support >= 50>> followers, whichever part of them your own soldiers have not apprehended,<<else>> followers<</if>> are flocking to Kalltland's borders. <<if $ch20_AcceptedAnafelOffer == true || $ch20_AcceptedAnafelOfferButLied == true || $ch20_Arington_Troops_without_marriage == true>> There has been no word, no further threat from the northern country; the regiment that was seen advancing towards your lands has fallen back, and there is no further sign of activity on their side.<<else>> The northern army that was seen progressing at the edge of your lands has fallen back, but they linger just behind your shared borders, perhaps waiting for a moment of weakness to strike. More foreign ships have taken to sailing along your shores; veterans have reported an eerie similarity to Kasri frigates.<</if>><<if $ch20_AcceptedAnafelOffer == true || $ch20_AcceptedAnafelOfferButLied == true || $ch20_Arington_Troops_without_marriage == true>> True to $a_his word, Anafel has sent a substantial number of troops to Goldridge; they guard the capital, and you, against any who would oppose your rule.<</if>><<if $ch20_AcceptedAnafelOffer == true || $ch20_AcceptedAnafelOfferButLied == true>> Anafel has visited, once, since the battle; to make sure you are in good health, and to invite you back to Arington, where $a_he is eager for you to meet $a_his family before the both of you can get married. <<if $ch20_AcceptedAnafelOfferButLied == true>> When you made $a_him aware of the fact that you had no intention of actually going through with your arrangement, $a_he did not outwardly let it phase $a_him; but $a_his troops have departed Arcadie in haste, and commerce between your two countries has been tremendously slowed down by what seems to be purposely ineffectual bureaucracy.<</if>><</if>> <<if $ch22_ousted == true>> Pascal Lacombe has decided to step down from his seat at the Noble Assembly, but the rest of the noble families refuse to meet with you, citing irreconcilable differences. <<if $ch23_attacked_cyril == true>> Cyril's family, in particular, is actively calling for your removal from the throne.<</if>><<else>> Your coronation is being planned by the Noble Assembly. It is to take place in the following weeks, after your family's burial ceremony.<</if>> <<if $ch23_willRO_dead == true>><center><<button [[Next|WillDeadEnd]]>><</button>></center><<elseif $ch23_cyrilRO_dead == true>><center><<button [[Next|CyrilDeadEnd]]>><</button>></center><<else>><center><<button [[Next|ROFinalScene]]>><</button>></center><</if>>You travel northward, heading for your shared border with Kalltland, and reach the desolate plains of Einberg. $wilfred's family's estate. The air is cold, the sky clear and very blue. You find the Keep—what remains of it; old, strong walls that lie half-crumbled, yet their foundation is intact; it could be rebuilt, in time. You discover a small crypt; reading names half-eroded by time, you confirm it belonging to House Steinmann. You lay $wilfred to rest amidst $w_his kin. It is what $w_he would have wanted, you imagine. You never had a chance to ask; you never had a choice but to venture a guess. You can only hope that it was the right one. <center><<button [[Next|RODeadEnd]]>><</button>></center>You join Cyril's parents in the Lavignac mausoleum, and $c_his white-haired mother smiles a weak smile, politely lamenting the circumstances of your meeting. $c_His father is a statue of restraint, barely opening his mouth to greet you. Elise is white as a sheet; she has barely slept, barely eaten, you can tell; and the chestnut-haired young man holding her arm stoically shakes your hand, introducing himself as Marc, Cyril's brother. You hunker around Cyril's coffin; it is open, and $c_he is inside, and it jars you, how peaceful $c_his features seem, so much so that one could be forgiven for believing $c_him simply asleep. You lay $c_him to rest, and when you come outside, <<if $cyril_engaged == true>> the pad of your thumb restlessly stroking the gold ring around your fourth finger,<</if>> the clear sky, the bright sun bear down on you like a warm knife. The manifestation of an indifferent world. <center><<button [[Next|RODeadEnd]]>><</button>></center>As you stand at your balcony, overlooking your mended gardens and your walls still undergoing reconstruction,<<if $lockedin_will == true>> $wilfred walks up behind you, and comes to fold $w_his arms over the white railing. The air is clean and the sky is pink with the sunset's blaze, and none of you speaks for a moment. "You did well, $mcname," $w_he says. "You should have some rest. <<if $ch22_ousted == true>> We still need to deal with the trouble with the Noble Assembly." <<else>> The coronation will demand much energy from you."<</if>> $w_He straightens $w_himself, and looks back towards the blue sea. "The hardest part is behind you, $mcname." You stare back towards the horizon. A bubble of apprehension scurries around your chest. While you might have dealt with Stanislas's threat, you are not so sure that the hardest part is indeed behind you.<<elseif $lockedin_cyril == true>> Cyril appears behind you, slipping an arm around your waist, resting $c_his head against <<if $mcgender == "female" && $cyril_gender == "male">> yours. <<else>> your shoulder.<</if>> "What are you thinking about?" $c_he whispers. "There is still so much to be done." $c_He hums next to your ear, pressing a soft kiss there. "You won't be doing it alone. I'm here for you." <<if $cyril_engaged == true>> $c_His free hand travels down your arm, finds the gold ring around your finger, and spins it softly. While you might have dealt with Stanislas's threat, you're not so sure that the hardest part is indeed behind you.<<elseif $ch17_nat_rom == true && $aether_blood_injected == true>>you almost jump as a bird suddenly decides to land inches away from your hands. Black and white, tail shimmering with vivid blue; the magpie regards you with dark, beady eyes, with what would surmise as an expectant look, were it sentient. You notice it is holding something in its beak; a small piece of parchment, rolled up and secured by a red string. The bird plops it down next to your fingers, and before you can react, it darts away, quick to take flight and disappear into a tree's leaves. You unfold the parchment, find elegant script written there. <i>Only fools sleep on their laurels.</i> <i>Your power beckons envy, fear and greed.</i> <i>Do not turn down help, when it will present itself.</i> Three cryptic sentences, and a lone 'N' drawn in the corner. You fold it back, keeping it in the palm of your hands as you stare at the horizon, a bubble of apprehension scurrying around your chest. You might have successfully dealt with Stanislas, but you have a hunch that you might eventually come to regard it as the easiest chapter of your reign.<<else>> a bubble of apprehension scurries around your chest. You might have successfully dealt with Stanislas, but you have a hunch that you might eventually come to regard it as the easiest chapter of your reign.<</if>> Whatever ordeal might await you tomorrow, is a tale remaining to be told. <center><<button [[Next|EndEpilogue]]>><</button>></center>As you peer sightlessly into the horizon, dread creeps over you, cloying like a blanket of regret. You might have prevailed over Stanislas, but in doing so, you've lost so much. And you have the sneaking suspicion that the days to come will not be getting any easier. Whatever ordeal might await you tomorrow, is a tale remaining to be told. <center><<button [[Next|EndEpilogue]]>><</button>></center><center><a data-passage="Credits-end" class="link-internal link-image"> <img src="img/theend.png" alt="The End" style="max-width: 100%"> </a></center><center><b>Writing and coding</b> [[Sofia D.|https://sofia-d-asb.tumblr.com]] <b>Design</b> Based on templates by [[a.w. morgan|https://awmorgan.itch.io/twine-sugarcube-template]] & [[brushmen|https://awmorgan.itch.io/twine-sugarcube-template]] <b>Icons</b> [[Font Awesome|https://fontawesome.com/]] <b>Beta testers</b> Alicia Aviva Blazingdragon ChairmanMeow Eiwynn eldensalkeld GrimReaperJr1232 Jeanette jippypen72 Joel Joshua jsc Kayla Laura Michael Nicola Pime RedRoses Sadie20 saorbhreathach Teetness theresnoway VirtualHummingbird Will Wouldyoukindly A game made with [[Twine|https://twinery.org/]] and [[SugarCube|https://www.motoslave.net/sugarcube/2/]] Custom macros by [[ChapelR|https://github.com/ChapelR/custom-macros-for-sugarcube-2]] Compiled with [[Twine App Builder|https://github.com/lazerwalker/twine-app-builder]] <b>"Arcadie: Second-Born"</b> is Copyright 2022 Sofia D. Your soldiers remain near the cell door as you take a step closer. <ul> <li>[[″You're lucky to be still alive.″->ShrtHate1][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″What do you have to say for yourself?″->ShrtHate1][$response = 2]]</li> <li>[[″So many lives lost, and for what?″->ShrtHate1][$response = 3]]</li> <li>[[″Is your cell to your liking, Stanislas?″->ShrtHate1][$response = 4]]</li> </ul>You've made sure his wounds would be tended to; his broken arm is in a rudimentary cast, and his various other wounds properly cleaned and bandaged. Your soldiers stand guard near the cell's door, and when you dismiss them, Stanislas tilts his head in a vague display of curiosity. You exchange a long, appraising stare. <ul> <li>[[I let him break the silence.->ShtStanLike][$response = 1]]</li> <li>[[″Is your cell to your liking, Stanislas?″->ShtStanLike][$response = 2]]</li> </ul><<if $response == 1>>"You're lucky to be still alive." "For how long, is the burning question," he says, staring up at you with dark, emotionless eyes. <<elseif $response == 2>>You take a deep, long breath. "It is," he simply answers, soon returning to staring at you in silence. <</if>><ul> <<if $ch23_cyrilRO_dead == true>><li>[[″You killed Cyril.″->ShtStanHate2][$response = 1]]</li><</if>> <<if $ch23_willRO_dead == true>><li>[["″You killed " + $wilfred + ".″"->ShtStanHate2][$response = 2]]</li><</if>> <li>[[″Was this all worth it, Stanislas?″->ShtStanHate2][$response = 3]]</li> </ul><<if $response == 1>>"You killed Cyril," you say, voice suddenly strained. Your accusatory glare is met with steely resolve. "The only reason Cyril is dead, is you." You make to reply, to object, but he continues, "By attaching $c_himself to you, $c_he willingly drew a target on $c_his back. $c_He was the Lavignac <<if $cyril_gender == "male">> heir. <<else>> heiress.<</if>> $c_Him dying fighting for your cause makes you far less likely to gain $c_his family's monetary support." He presses the back of his skull against the wall behind him. "Without money, no soldiers. Without soldiers, no wars. As far as I'm concerned, Cyril being dead is a boon." <<elseif $response == 2>>"You killed $wilfred," you say, voice suddenly strained. "$w_He was your childhood friend; your almost <<if $will_gender == "male">> brother." <<else>> sister."<</if>> And the $w_man you loved. Your accusatory glare is met with silence. Stanislas holds your gaze, and a frown folds his brow as he finally decides to reply. "Don't lay the blame on me, $mcname. $wilfred is dead because of <i>you</i>—because you and your family made $w_him into a pawn in your schemes. $w_He followed you, swore $w_his life to you; $w_he wouldn't accept that what you and your dreadful caste have ever done, will ever do, is demand more blood, more death, more power." He presses the back of his skull against the wall behind him. "I loved $w_him like a <<if $will_gender == "male">> brother, <<else>> sister,<</if>> and I hate you for $w_his death." <<elseif $response == 3>>"Was this all worth it, Stanislas?" "I have nothing worthwhile to say to you, $mcname. You've won. Congratulations. Now hold a trial, let me answer for my alleged crimes before a court of justice. Stanislas watches you go without another word. <center><<button [[Next|ShtStanAlive]]>><</button>></center> <<elseif $response == 2>><<set $ch23_MCKilledStan = true>> "Fine." He makes no other sound as you run your sword through him. <center><<button [[Next|ShtStanDead]]>><</button>></center> <<elseif $response == 3>>"There will be nothing quick about your death." Stanislas watches you go without another word. <center><<button [[Next|ShtStanAlive]]>><</button>></center>With Stanislas being held in your dungeons,<<if $pacifist < 60>> his partisans have either deserted, been apprehended by soldiers loyal to you, or decided to try and make themselves scarce. <<if $ch22_cyril_loyal == true>> The Peacekeeping Force does a tremendous job of locating the latter group.<</if>><<else>> some of his followers have decided to lay down their weapons, and surrender to your forces. <<if $ch22_cyril_loyal == true>> The rest is to be hunted by the Peacekeeping Force.<</if>><</if>> <<include ShtKalltland>>With Stanislas dead, his partisans have either deserted, been apprehended by soldiers loyal to you, or decided to make themselves scarce.<<if $ch22_cyril_loyal == true>> The Peacekeeping Force does a tremendous job of locating the latter group.<</if>> <<include ShtKalltland>><<if $response == 2>>"Is your cell to your liking, Stanislas?" "Ariana and your parents—their bodies—are in the cellar. You'll want to give them a proper burial, I presume."<<set $bodies = false>> <<include ShtStanLoop>><ul> <<if not hasVisited ("ShtSBodies")>><li>[[″What did you do with their bodies?″->ShtSBodies]]</li><</if>> <<if not hasVisited ("ShtSWe") && $bodies == true>><li>[[″Who's this 'we' you're referring to?″->ShtSWe]]</li><</if>> <<if not hasVisited ("ShtSViews")>><li>[[″Our views are not so dissimilar; I hold no love for war.″->ShtSViews]]</li><</if>> <<if not hasVisited ("ShtSremorse")>><li>[[″You've murdered my entire family. "Nothing at all, except for gathering some of their blood; Serene's blood, Ariana's blood—which was far less potent than we expected. But I understand why, now; there was no Aether, no Gift left in her." He stretches his neck. "Our fight would have gone very differently, had Ariana not passed on her power to you." <<include ShtStanLoop>>"Who's this 'we' you're referring to?" "Myskia and I; Myskia being the 'peace' emissary you did not get a chance to kill," he clarifies. He gazes up at you, studying you. "$mcname, Kalltland knows a great deal about Aether, much more than your parents led you to believe. Remember that, in any future dealings you might have with them." "What do they know that Arcadie doesn't?" He presses the back of his skull against the wall supporting him. "Things your ancestors were arrogant enough to forget. Other things I'm sure they did their utmost at suppressing." "What things?" He lifts his eyebrows in an impression of a shrug. "You're not going to give me a straight answer, are you?" A small smile pulls on the corner of his chapped lips. "Seems you've got me all figured out, Your Majesty." <<include ShtStanLoop>>You take a moment to gaze at him, taking in the deep red scar at the edge of his jaw, and the speckles of red, superficial wounds still dotting his face like as many freckles. "While I obviously can't agree with your methods," you say, "I understand your motives. Our views are not so dissimilar; I hold no love for war." "I know." He returns a careful look your way. "May Arcadie flourish under your rule." <<include ShtStanLoop>>"You've murdered my entire family," you state. "Do you feel any remorse for what you did?" "No," comes his instant reply. "When words stop holding power, blood must be spilt. I know my actions are unforgivable, but I was ready to lay down my life for Arcadie's future, for the end of tyranny." He gives you a long, unblinking look. "I still am." <<include ShtStanLoop>>"So," he says, rattling his chains. "What is to be my fate, Your Majesty? Summary execution? Lifelong torture?" he asks in a placid tone. "Perhaps a farce of a trial?"<<set $StanWork = false>> <ul> <<if not hasVisited ("ShtSDoWYou")>><li>[[″What would you have me do with you?″->ShtSDoWYou]]</li><</if>> <<if not hasVisited ("ShtSAnswer")>><li>[[″You need to answer for your crimes, one way or another.″->ShtSAnswer]]</li><</if>> <li>[[I've made my decision. ->ShtSDecide]]</li> </ul><<set $StanWork = true>> "What would you have me do with you?" He blinks, a curious smile splitting his lips. "What I would like you to do, what I expect you to do, and what you should do, are vastly different matters." "What do you believe I should do, then?" "The prudent, short-sighted choice would be to have me executed, of course." Stanislas pauses, taking a moment to stare into your $eye_color eyes. "The smart choice would be to let me help you." "Help me?" "Yes. Help you strengthen your rule, and the Kingdom; help you avoid making the same mistakes your predecessors made. Help you face Kalltland, who have no intention of letting a single d'Arcadie live." "Of course. The murderer of my kin, to be my adviser. What a brilliant idea." "It might be unorthodox, but having the man who was hell-bent on murdering you eventually joining your side instead, is not a feat many could have accomplished." The square of sun on the opposite wall is reflected in his gray irises, turning them into a swirl of gold and amber. "You have the makings of a good $king. You have wisdom and strength. With only a little guidance, you could be the most just, reasonable monarch that ever sat on Arcadie's throne." <ul> <<if not hasVisited ("ShtSAnswer")>><li>[[″You need to answer for your crimes, one way or another.″->ShtSAnswer]]</li><</if>> <li>[[I've made my decision. ->ShtSDecide]]</li> </ul>"You need to answer for your crimes, one way or another. Your actions cannot go unpunished." He nods. "I understand. Do you intend to make an example out of me, then?" <ul> <<if not hasVisited ("ShtSDoWYou")>><li>[[″What would you have me do with you?″->ShtSDoWYou]]</li><</if>> <li>[[I've made my decision. ->ShtSDecide]]</li> </ul><ul> <li>[[″You'll stand before a court of law.″->ShtStanDecisionF][$response = 1]]</li> <<if $StanWork == true>><li>[[Executing him would be a waste. I will put him to work.->ShtStanDecisionF][$response = 2]]</li><</if>> <li>[[″You will be executed.″->ShtStanDecisionF][$response = 3]]</li> </ul><<if $response == 1>><<set $StanLaw = true>> "You will stand before a court of law," you decide. "Justice will decide your fate." He gathers a knee closer, and stretches out his wrist over it. "The sentence for regicide is death," he points out with a smile that doesn't reach his eyes. "I gather public execution is to be my fate, then." <<elseif $response == 2>><<set $StanHelp = true>> "The wheels of justice are sometimes slow to turn," you say after a long while. Stanislas stops staring at his nails to level a vague frown at you. "You'll remain in the Palace, as a prisoner," you declare. "But I won't have you remaining idle; you will help the Crown rebuild what you've destroyed, locate men still loyal to your cause, and help prepare the Kingdom to defend against the imminent threat you seem to believe Kalltland to be." He frowns, saying nothing at all. "If you'd rather meet the gallows, you only need to say the word, Stanislas." "No," he quickly replies. "I am only… surprised." <<elseif $response == 3>>"You will be executed," you decide, crossing your arms. He gathers a knee closer, and stretches out his wrist over it. "Without even a trial? Well, I suppose a trial would reach the same sentence, anyway," he muses with a smile that doesn't reach his eyes. <</if>>After a few seconds of quiet, it seems there is nothing left to discuss, so you prepare to leave, turning back towards the wooden cell door and giving it a solid knock, calling back your men. <<if $StanHelp == false || $ch20_Kiss_S == false>> Stanislas watches you go without another word.<<else>>"$mcname." You hear the clink of chains, and pivot back to watch Stanislas rising to his feet, using the wall at his back to steady himself. "Nothing I say or do will deaden the pain and suffering I've inflicted upon you." He licks his lower lip, and fixes you with a steady gaze. "Still, I would like to apologize to you, $mcname." It rattles you more than you would have expected; and you only realize you've stopped breathing when your next intake of air is excessively sharp. "While I don't regret anything I have done," he adds, "I do wish that I had met you earlier." "Why?" you ask. "Would you have done things differently, if you had?" A strand of black hair tilts along his brow, almost reaching his eyes. "I'm sure I would have been mesmerized by your world view; perhaps you would have been able to sway your mother, Serene, or at least be a voice of reason in the throne room." He smiles, tipping his head a little to the side. "What I'm sure of, is that I would have been too stupidly in love with you to consider murdering your family." The door opens. Your soldiers have returned, ready to accompany you back to the Palace proper. Stanislas sits back down. "You should go. You have important business to attend to, I'm sure." When you only keep staring at him, he parts with a placid smile. "Till we meet again, Your Majesty."<</if>> <center><<button [[Next|ShtStanAlive]]>><</button>></center>Rumors have it that what remains of Stanislas's followers are flocking to Kalltland's borders. <<if $ch20_AcceptedAnafelOffer == true || $ch20_AcceptedAnafelOfferButLied == true || $ch20_Arington_Troops_without_marriage == true>> There has been no word, no further threat from the northern country; the regiment that was seen advancing towards your lands has fallen back, and there is no further sign of activity on their side.<<else>> The northern army that was seen progressing at the edge of your lands has fallen back, but they linger just behind your shared borders, perhaps waiting for a moment of weakness to strike. More foreign ships have taken to sailing along your shores; veterans have reported an eerie similarity to Kasri frigates. <</if>><<if $ch20_AcceptedAnafelOffer == true || $ch20_AcceptedAnafelOfferButLied == true || $ch20_Arington_Troops_without_marriage == true>> True to $a_his word, Anafel has sent a substantial number of troops to Goldridge; they guard the capital, and you, against any who would oppose your rule.<<if $ch20_AcceptedAnafelOffer == true || $ch20_AcceptedAnafelOfferButLied == true>> Anafel has visited, once, since the battle; to make sure you are in good health, and to invite you back to Arington, where $a_he is eager for you to meet $a_his family before the both of you can get married. <<if $ch20_AcceptedAnafelOfferButLied == true>> When you made $a_him aware of the fact that you had no intention of actually going through with your arrangement, $a_he did not outwardly let it phase $a_him; but $a_his troops have departed Arcadie in haste, and commerce between your two countries has been tremendously slowed down by what seems to be purposely ineffectual bureaucracy.<</if>><</if>><</if>> <<if $ch22_ousted == true>> Pascal Lacombe has decided to step down from his seat at the Noble Assembly, but the rest of the noble families refuse to meet with you, citing irreconcilable differences. <<if $ch23_attacked_cyril == true>> Cyril's family, in particular, is actively calling for your removal from the throne.<</if>><<else>> Your coronation is being planned by the Noble Assembly. It is to take place in the following weeks, after your family's burial ceremony.<</if>> <<if $ch23_willRO_dead == true>><center><<button [[Next|ShtWillfuneral]]>><</button>></center><<elseif $ch23_cyrilRO_dead == true>><center><<button [[Next|ShtCyrilfuneral]]>><</button>></center><<else>><center><<button [[Next|ShtROFinalScene]]>><</button>></center><</if>>You travel northward, heading for your shared border with Kalltland, and reach the desolate plains of Einberg. $wilfred's family's estate. The air is cold, the sky clear and very blue. You find the Keep—what remains of it; old, strong walls that lie half-crumbled, yet their foundation is intact; it could be rebuilt, in time. You discover a small crypt; reading names half-eroded by time, you confirm it belonging to House Steinmann. You lay $wilfred to rest amidst $w_his kin. It is what $w_he would have wanted, you imagine. You never had a chance to ask. You never had a choice but to venture a guess. You can only hope that it was the right one. As you peer sightlessly into the horizon, dread creeps over you, cloying like a blanket of regret. You might have prevailed over Stanislas, but in doing so, you've lost so much. And you have the sneaking suspicion that the days to come will not be getting any easier. Whatever ordeal might await you tomorrow, is a tale remaining to be told. <center><<button [[Next|EndEpilogue]]>><</button>></center>You join Cyril's parents in the Lavignac mausoleum, and $c_his white-haired mother smiles a weak smile, politely lamenting the circumstances of your meeting. $c_His father is a statue of restraint, barely opening his mouth to greet you. Elise is white as a sheet; she has barely slept, barely eaten, you can tell; and the chestnut-haired young man holding her arm stoically shakes your hand, introducing himself as Marc, Cyril's brother. You hunker around Cyril's coffin; it is open, and $c_he is inside, and it jars you, how peaceful $c_his features seem, so much so that one could be forgiven for believing $c_him simply asleep. Black and white, tail shimmering with vivid blue; the magpie regards you with dark, beady eyes, with what would surmise as an expectant look, were it sentient. You notice it is holding something in its beak; a small piece of parchment, rolled up and secured by a red string. The bird plops it down next to your fingers, and before you can react, it darts away, quick to take flight and disappear into a tree's leaves. You unfold the parchment, find elegant script written there. <i>Only fools sleep on their laurels.</i> <i>Your power beckons envy, fear and greed.</i> <i>Do not turn down help, when it will present itself.</i> Three cryptic sentences, and a lone 'N' drawn in the corner. You fold it back, keeping it in the palm of your hands as you stare at the horizon, a bubble of apprehension scurrying around your chest.
